commit_message:
incorrect enable plugin url in doc

This is incorrect url in README.rst example case:
enable_plugin freezer https://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer.git master

change the url to: https://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer

Change-Id: I599af680102f858bf52460a0e2d400b9974616d1
(cherry picked from commit a1c89ba75c40fc9dc8c8346b1ddf3959b3018332)

commit_message:
Fix auth_url for cinder configuration

This fix configures the auth_url parameter to use keystone_service_adminurl
over the existing keystone_service_adminuri parameter which actually leads
to a incomplete URL lacking the API version like /v3/tokens

Change-Id: Ib2f47cb62bd9098fa2e7335f7f776b525da71ac3
Related-Bug: #1552394
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/30/288730/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth_url = {{ keystone_service_adminurl }}

commit_message:
Store events in Undercloud Ceilometer

Adds a store_events option to allow admins to configure
the Undercloud Ceilometer to store events.

The default is false.

Change-Id: I9d9ae8eb2e1ec069e2ecd0bcf553f57647750ef1
Related-Bug: rhbz#1312373

commit_message:
swift: use bulk deletes

we read and write a lot of data constantly. swift supports deleting
objects in bulk[1] so we should leverage this so we can minimise
the number of calls we make to delete objects. this can save
potentially thousands of calls depending on backlog size.

this adds a requirement to configure swift with bulk-filter middleware.

Change-Id: I13afc90d7f67b3d7f213f48f92fc76a1f544861b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/84/278584/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves.urllib.parse import quote def _bulk_delete(self, container, objects): objects = [quote(('/%s/%s' % (container, obj['name'])).encode('utf-8')) for obj in objects] headers, body = self.swift.post_account( query_string='bulk-delete', data=b''.join(obj.encode('utf-8') + b'\n' for obj in objects)) self._bulk_delete(self.MEASURE_PREFIX, files) self._bulk_delete(self.MEASURE_PREFIX, files) self._bulk_delete(container, files)
deleted_lines: for f in files: try: self.swift.delete_object(self.MEASURE_PREFIX, f['name']) except swclient.ClientException as e: # If the object has already been deleted by another worker, do # not worry. if e.http_status != 404: raise for f in files: self.swift.delete_object(self.MEASURE_PREFIX, f['name']) for obj in files: self.swift.delete_object(container, obj['name'])

commit_message:
Revert "functional: Grab the service version from the module"

This reverts commit d411d60587e54dd364b7a329035726f2e281a9f7.

The point of doc/*samples* is they are static files, not
dynamic. We shouldn't be doing substitution here, this
breaks all kinds of things, including the doc target.

Change-Id: Iaaf9fa0096ab62e6d3efbe018d8d4853a2ff8cda
Closes-Bug: #1553634

commit_message:
Resolve name/id using translation rules

This changes the first set of neutron resouces to
use translation rules to resolve name_id properties.

Changed reources:

- OS::Neutron::Subnet
- OS::Neutron::Port
- OS::Neutron::Router
- OS::Neutron::FloatingIp

Change-Id: I13f30abb5e284beff4ece9e0c88ee7319ff1be80
Partial-Bug: #1514680
Closes-Bug: #1553362

commit_message:
Cleanup DataSource Driver only if it has a worker_thread

DataSourceDriver tries to delete worker_thread anytime when it deletes
datasources. It will make an error if push-type datasource is deleted
because it usually doesn't have a worker thread.

Closes-Bug: #1553982
Change-Id: I9623d25b4814281ac0f167734c3a1ce489eb0fae

commit_message:
Allow deleting gateway interfaces on network topology

We didn't allow to delete a router_gateway interface from a router
in the network topology due to the checking being done
working only on normal interfaces.

Change-Id: I35f7fc7c0050e1441a740a110fb6f45ddec9371d
Closes-Bug: 1548224

commit_message:
Store config in drivers and use it to get list_limit

With domain-specific configs, different drivers will be used for
different domains. Options might be different for these drivers. For
example, user might want to user different list_limit for a domain.

Partial-Bug: 1495669
Change-Id: I706843d7860ec5718c9fbf62af7a65b89b67e4b3

commit_message:
Make sure to install apt-transport-https

This patch makes sure that apt-transport-https is installed, and
avoids failure in gate job now running with ubuntu-trusty.

Change-Id: Iaf578990cfd80d9565d6de8fb0d7ee8258175720

commit_message:
Adding authentication compatibility for OpenStackClient

In ksa, plugins loading is managed by ksa.
OpenStackClient token_endpoint plugin expects get_auth_ref[1],
(a method consistent with ksa auth plugins) which is not implemented
in ksa token_endpoint.

This change will not change overall ksa behavior, as it only makes
OpenStackClient to be able to provide its token_endpoint plugin,
necessary for authentication migration in osc from ksc to ksa[2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/
master/openstackclient/api/auth_plugin.py#L48-L50
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystoneauth/migrating.html

Change-Id: I7d8f9a9f071a0d37244f8985bd7d09d49ba79eb8
Closes-Bug: 1533369

commit_message:
tempest: use ceilometer client manager instead of tempest one

This patch replaces client manager used in base test class from tempest
one to ceilometer dedicated manager which only has clients used in
ceilometer tests.

The conflicts in config parameter are solved by adding '_plugin' in
paramter names as suffix.

This patch also includes the following changes in tempest.

  - Ie99bbbe7655138c4c3ecae69ae0b361198a9651d
  - I340d96c27f0e906df5b8a109494920e9cd3b21d1
  - I14e16a1a7d9813b324ee40545c07f0e88fb637b7

Closes-Bug: 1549424
Depends-On: Ifc29617743b76b01eb6cd30a375cf47b56e4f635
Change-Id: I97842d2766adcf04139422e7904082317b0583cf
Implements: blueprint tempest-plugin

commit_message:
Remove experimental-bindep-jobs from repos

Since we now switched to bindep, we can remove these experimental jobs
from all repositories.

Also remove jenkins/jobs/experimental-workers.yaml, it's not needed
currently.

Change-Id: I4c1e2e4e49cf5961b90a3f91e0531bbffc95feb8

The configuration file of this module is ``/etc/ironic/ironic." "conf``." msgstr "" #: ../bare-metal.rst:9 msgid "" "The following tables provide a comprehensive list of the Bare metal service " "configuration options." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage.rst:3 msgid "Block Storage" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage.rst:19 msgid "" "The OpenStack Block Storage service works with many different storage " "drivers that you can configure by using these instructions." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup-drivers.rst:3 msgid "Backup drivers" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup-drivers.rst:12 msgid "" "This section describes how to configure the cinder-backup service and its " "drivers." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup-drivers.rst:15 msgid "" "The volume drivers are included with the `Block Storage repository <https://" "git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/cinder/>`_. To set a backup driver, use the " "``backup_driver`` flag. By default there is no backup driver enabled." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:0 msgid "Description of Ceph backup driver configuration options" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:3 msgid "Ceph backup driver" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:5 msgid "" "The Ceph backup driver backs up volumes of any type to a Ceph back-end " "store. The driver can also detect whether the volume to be backed up is a " "Ceph RBD volume, and if so, it tries to perform incremental and differential " "backups." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:10 msgid "" "For source Ceph RBD volumes, you can perform backups within the same Ceph " "pool (not recommended). You can also perform backups between different Ceph " "pools and between different Ceph clusters." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:14 msgid "" "At the time of writing, differential backup support in Ceph/librbd was quite " "new. This driver attempts a differential backup in the first instance. If " "the differential backup fails, the driver falls back to full backup/copy." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:19 msgid "" "If incremental backups are used, multiple backups of the same volume are " "stored as snapshots so that minimal space is consumed in the backup store. " "It takes far less time to restore a volume than to take a full copy." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:26 msgid "Block Storage enables you to:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:28 msgid "Restore to a new volume, which is the default and recommended action." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:31 msgid "" "Restore to the original volume from which the backup was taken. The restore " "action takes a full copy because this is the safest action." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:35 msgid "" "To enable the Ceph backup driver, include the following option in the " "``cinder.conf`` file:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:42 msgid "" "The following configuration options are available for the Ceph backup driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.rst:47 msgid "This example shows the default options for the Ceph backup driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/nfs-backup-driver.rst:0 msgid "Description of NFS backup driver configuration options" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/nfs-backup-driver.rst:3 msgid "NFS backup driver" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/nfs-backup-driver.rst:5 msgid "" "The backup driver for the NFS back end backs up volumes of any type to an " "NFS exported backup repository." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/nfs-backup-driver.rst:8 msgid "" "To enable the NFS backup driver, include the following option in the " "``[DEFAULT]`` section of the ``cinder.conf`` file:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/nfs-backup-driver.rst:15 msgid "" "The following configuration options are available for the NFS back-end " "backup driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.rst:0 msgid "Description of Swift backup driver configuration options" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.rst:3 msgid "Swift backup driver" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.rst:5 msgid "" "The backup driver for the swift back end performs a volume backup to an " "object storage system." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.rst:8 msgid "" "To enable the swift backup driver, include the following option in the " "``cinder.conf`` file:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.rst:15 msgid "" "The following configuration options are available for the Swift back-end " "backup driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.rst:20 msgid "" "To enable the swift backup driver for 1.0 or 2.0 authentication version, " "specify ``1`` or ``2`` correspondingly. For example:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.rst:27 msgid "" "In addition, the 2.0 authentication system requires the definition of the " "``backup_swift_tenant`` setting:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.rst:34 msgid "" "This example shows the default options for the Swift back-end backup driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/tsm-backup-driver.rst:0 msgid "" "Description of IBM Tivoli Storage Manager backup driver configuration options" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/tsm-backup-driver.rst:3 msgid "IBM Tivoli Storage Manager backup driver" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/tsm-backup-driver.rst:5 msgid "" "The IBM Tivoli Storage Manager (TSM) backup driver enables performing volume " "backups to a TSM server." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/tsm-backup-driver.rst:8 msgid "" "The TSM client should be installed and configured on the machine running the " "cinder-backup service. See the IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Backup-Archive " "Client Installation and User's Guide for details on installing the TSM " "client." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/tsm-backup-driver.rst:13 msgid "" "To enable the IBM TSM backup driver, include the following option in " "``cinder.conf``:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/tsm-backup-driver.rst:20 msgid "" "The following configuration options are available for the TSM backup driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/backup/tsm-backup-driver.rst:25 msgid "This example shows the default options for the TSM backup driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:3 msgid "Introduction to the Block Storage service" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:5 msgid "" "The Block Storage service provides persistent block storage resources that " "Compute instances can consume. This includes secondary attached storage " "similar to the Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS) offering. In addition, you " "can write images to a Block Storage device for Compute to use as a bootable " "persistent instance." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:11 msgid "" "The Block Storage service differs slightly from the Amazon EBS offering. The " "Block Storage service does not provide a shared storage solution like NFS. " "With the Block Storage service, you can attach a device to only one instance." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:16 msgid "The Block Storage service provides:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:18 msgid "" "``cinder-api`` - a WSGI app that authenticates and routes requests " "throughout the Block Storage service. It supports the OpenStack APIs only, " "although there is a translation that can be done through Compute's EC2 " "interface, which calls in to the Block Storage client." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:23 msgid "" "``cinder-scheduler`` - schedules and routes requests to the appropriate " "volume service. Depending upon your configuration, this may be simple round-" "robin scheduling to the running volume services, or it can be more " "sophisticated through the use of the Filter Scheduler. The Filter Scheduler " "is the default and enables filters on things like Capacity, Availability " "Zone, Volume Types, and Capabilities as well as custom filters." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:31 msgid "" "``cinder-volume`` - manages Block Storage devices, specifically the back-end " "devices themselves." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:34 msgid "" "``cinder-backup`` - provides a means to back up a Block Storage volume to " "OpenStack Object Storage (swift)." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:37 msgid "The Block Storage service contains the following components:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:39 msgid "" "**Back-end Storage Devices** - the Block Storage service requires some form " "of back-end storage that the service is built on. The default implementation " "is to use LVM on a local volume group named "cinder-volumes." In addition " "to the base driver implementation, the Block Storage service also provides " "the means to add support for other storage devices to be utilized such as " "external Raid Arrays or other storage appliances. These back-end storage " "devices may have custom block sizes when using KVM or QEMU as the hypervisor." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:48 msgid "" "**Users and Tenants (Projects)** - the Block Storage service can be used by " "many different cloud computing consumers or customers (tenants on a shared " "system), using role-based access assignments. Roles control the actions that " "a user is allowed to perform. In the default configuration, most actions do " "not require a particular role, but this can be configured by the system " "administrator in the appropriate ``policy.json`` file that maintains the " "rules. A user's access to particular volumes is limited by tenant, but the " "user name and password are assigned per user. Key pairs granting access to a " "volume are enabled per user, but quotas to control resource consumption " "across available hardware resources are per tenant." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# shared-file-systems.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:60 #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:50 msgid "For tenants, quota controls are available to limit:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:62 msgid "The number of volumes that can be created." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:64 msgid "The number of snapshots that can be created." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:66 msgid "" "The total number of GBs allowed per tenant (shared between snapshots and " "volumes)." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:69 msgid "" "You can revise the default quota values with the Block Storage CLI, so the " "limits placed by quotas are editable by admin users." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:72 msgid "" "**Volumes, Snapshots, and Backups** - the basic resources offered by the " "Block Storage service are volumes and snapshots which are derived from " "volumes and volume backups:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:76 msgid "" "**Volumes** - allocated block storage resources that can be attached to " "instances as secondary storage or they can be used as the root store to boot " "instances. Volumes are persistent R/W block storage devices most commonly " "attached to the compute node through iSCSI." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:82 msgid "" "**Snapshots** - a read-only point in time copy of a volume. The snapshot can " "be created from a volume that is currently in use (through the use of ``--" "force True``) or in an available state. The snapshot can then be used to " "create a new volume through create from snapshot." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-overview.rst:88 msgid "" "**Backups** - an archived copy of a volume currently stored in Object " "Storage (swift)." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:5 msgid "Block Storage sample configuration files" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:7 msgid "All the files in this section can be found in ``/etc/cinder``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:10 msgid "cinder.conf" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:12 msgid "" "The ``cinder.conf`` file is installed in ``/etc/cinder`` by default. When " "you manually install the Block Storage service, the options in the ``cinder." "conf`` file are set to default values." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:16 msgid "" "The ``cinder.conf`` file contains most of the options to configure the Block " "Storage service. Here is the sample configuration file and you can generate " "the latest configuration file by using the tox provided by the Block Storage " "service." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# networking.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# shared-file-systems.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:25 #: ../compute/api-paste.ini.rst:3 #: ../networking/sample-configuration-files.rst:25 #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:21 msgid "api-paste.ini" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:27 msgid "" "Use the ``api-paste.ini`` file to configure the Block Storage API service." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# identity.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# image-service.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# networking.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# shared-file-systems.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# telemetry.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:35 #: ../compute/policy.json.rst:3 ../identity/sample-configuration-files.rst:42 #: ../image-service/sample-configuration-files.rst:83 #: ../networking/sample-configuration-files.rst:35 #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:31 #: ../telemetry/sample-configuration-files.rst:62 msgid "policy.json" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:37 msgid "" "The ``policy.json`` file defines additional access controls that apply to " "the Block Storage service." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# networking.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# shared-file-systems.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:45 #: ../compute/rootwrap.conf.rst:3 #: ../networking/sample-configuration-files.rst:44 #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:41 msgid "rootwrap.conf" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/block-storage-sample-configuration-files.rst:47 msgid "" "The ``rootwrap.conf`` file defines configuration values used by the " "``rootwrap`` script when the Block Storage service must escalate its " "privileges to those of the root user." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:0 msgid "Description of BlockBridge EPS volume driver configuration options" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:3 msgid "Blockbridge EPS" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:6 #: ../compute/hypervisor-vmware.rst:6 msgid "Introduction" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:8 msgid "" "Blockbridge is software that transforms commodity infrastructure into secure " "multi-tenant storage that operates as a programmable service. It provides " "automatic encryption, secure deletion, quality of service, replication, and " "programmable security capabilities on your choice of hardware. Blockbridge " "uses micro-segmentation to provide isolation that allows you to concurrently " "operate OpenStack, Docker, and bare-metal workflows on shared resources. " "When used with OpenStack, isolated management domains are dynamically " "created on a per-project basis. All volumes and clones, within and between " "projects, are automatically cryptographically isolated and implement secure " "deletion." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:20 msgid "Architecture reference" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:22 msgid "**Blockbridge architecture**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:29 msgid "Control paths" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:31 msgid "" "The Blockbridge driver is packaged with the core distribution of OpenStack. " "Operationally, it executes in the context of the Block Storage service. The " "driver communicates with an OpenStack-specific API provided by the " "Blockbridge EPS platform. Blockbridge optionally communicates with Identity, " "Compute, and Block Storage services." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:39 msgid "Block storage API" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:41 msgid "" "Blockbridge is API driven software-defined storage. The system implements a " "native HTTP API that is tailored to the specific needs of OpenStack. Each " "Block Storage service operation maps to a single back-end API request that " "provides ACID semantics. The API is specifically designed to reduce, if not " "eliminate, the possibility of inconsistencies between the Block Storage " "service and external storage infrastructure in the event of hardware, " "software or data center failure." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:51 msgid "Extended management" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:53 msgid "" "OpenStack users may utilize Blockbridge interfaces to manage replication, " "auditing, statistics, and performance information on a per-project and per-" "volume basis. In addition, they can manage low-level data security functions " "including verification of data authenticity and encryption key delegation. " "Native integration with the Identity Service allows tenants to use a single " "set of credentials. Integration with Block storage and Compute services " "provides dynamic metadata mapping when using Blockbridge management APIs and " "tools." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:63 msgid "Attribute-based provisioning" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:65 msgid "" "Blockbridge organizes resources using descriptive identifiers called " "*attributes*. Attributes are assigned by administrators of the " "infrastructure. They are used to describe the characteristics of storage in " "an application-friendly way. Applications construct queries that describe " "storage provisioning constraints and the Blockbridge storage stack assembles " "the resources as described." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:72 msgid "" "Any given instance of a Blockbridge volume driver specifies a *query* for " "resources. For example, a query could specify ``'+ssd +10.0.0.0 +6nines -" "production iops.reserve=1000 capacity.reserve=30%'``. This query is " "satisfied by selecting SSD resources, accessible on the 10.0.0.0 network, " "with high resiliency, for non-production workloads, with guaranteed IOPS of " "1000 and a storage reservation for 30% of the volume capacity specified at " "create time. Queries and parameters are completely administrator defined: " "they reflect the layout, resource, and organizational goals of a specific " "deployment." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:101 msgid "Supported protocols" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:103 msgid "" "Blockbridge provides iSCSI access to storage. A unique iSCSI data fabric is " "programmatically assembled when a volume is attached to an instance. A " "fabric is disassembled when a volume is detached from an instance. Each " "volume is an isolated SCSI device that supports persistent reservations." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:110 msgid "Configuration steps" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:115 msgid "Create an authentication token" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:117 msgid "" "Whenever possible, avoid using password-based authentication. Even if you " "have created a role-restricted administrative user via Blockbridge, token-" "based authentication is preferred. You can generate persistent " "authentication tokens using the Blockbridge command-line tool as follows:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:149 msgid "Create volume type" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:151 msgid "" "Before configuring and enabling the Blockbridge volume driver, register an " "OpenStack volume type and associate it with a ``volume_backend_name``. In " "this example, a volume type, 'Production', is associated with the " "``volume_backend_name`` 'blockbridge\_prod':" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:162 msgid "Specify volume driver" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:164 msgid "" "Configure the Blockbridge volume driver in ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf``. Your " "``volume_backend_name`` must match the value specified in the :command:" "`cinder type-key` command in the previous step." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:174 msgid "Specify API endpoint and authentication" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:176 msgid "" "Configure the API endpoint and authentication. The following example uses an " "authentication token. You must create your own as described in :ref:" "`cg_create_an_authentication_token`." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:186 msgid "Specify resource query" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:188 msgid "" "By default, a single pool is configured (implied) with a default resource " "query of ``'+openstack'``. Within Blockbridge, datastore resources that " "advertise the 'openstack' attribute will be selected to fulfill OpenStack " "provisioning requests. If you prefer a more specific query, define a custom " "pool configuration." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:198 msgid "" "Pools support storage systems that offer multiple classes of service. You " "may wish to configure multiple pools to implement more sophisticated " "scheduling capabilities." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:203 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-scaleio-driver.rst:228 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:0 #: ../block-storage/drivers/nimble-volume-driver.rst:132 msgid "Configuration options" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:210 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-scaleio-driver.rst:205 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-xtremio-driver.rst:178 #: ../block-storage/drivers/fujitsu-eternus-dx-driver.rst:208 msgid "Configuration example" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:212 msgid "``cinder.conf`` example file" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:235 msgid "Multiple volume types" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:237 msgid "" "Volume *types* are exposed to tenants, *pools* are not. To offer multiple " "classes of storage to OpenStack tenants, you should define multiple volume " "types. Simply repeat the process above for each desired type. Be sure to " "specify a unique ``volume_backend_name`` and pool configuration for each " "type. The :ref:`cinder.conf <cg_configuration_example>` example included " "with this documentation illustrates configuration of multiple types." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:246 msgid "Testing resources" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/blockbridge-eps-driver.rst:248 msgid "" "Blockbridge is freely available for testing purposes and deploys in seconds " "as a Docker container. This is the same container used to run continuous " "integration for OpenStack. For more information visit `www.blockbridge.io " "<http://www.blockbridge.io>`__." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:0 msgid "Description of Ceph storage configuration options" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:3 msgid "Ceph RADOS Block Device (RBD)" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:5 msgid "" "If you use KVM or QEMU as your hypervisor, you can configure the Compute " "service to use `Ceph RADOS block devices (RBD) <http://ceph.com/ceph-storage/" "block-storage/>`__ for volumes." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:9 msgid "" "Ceph is a massively scalable, open source, distributed storage system. It is " "comprised of an object store, block store, and a POSIX-compliant distributed " "file system. The platform can auto-scale to the exabyte level and beyond. It " "runs on commodity hardware, is self-healing and self-managing, and has no " "single point of failure. Ceph is in the Linux kernel and is integrated with " "the OpenStack cloud operating system. Due to its open-source nature, you can " "install and use this portable storage platform in public or private clouds." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:20 msgid "Ceph architecture" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:23 msgid "RADOS" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:25 msgid "" "Ceph is based on Reliable Autonomic Distributed Object Store (RADOS). RADOS " "distributes objects across the storage cluster and replicates objects for " "fault tolerance. RADOS contains the following major components:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:31 msgid "" "The storage daemon for the RADOS service, which interacts with the OSD " "(physical or logical storage unit for your data). You must run this daemon " "on each server in your cluster. For each OSD, you can have an associated " "hard drive disk. For performance purposes, pool your hard drive disk with " "raid arrays, logical volume management (LVM), or B-tree file system (Btrfs) " "pooling. By default, the following pools are created: data, metadata, and " "RBD." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:37 msgid "*Object Storage Device (OSD) Daemon*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:40 msgid "" "Stores metadata. MDSs build a POSIX file system on top of objects for Ceph " "clients. However, if you do not use the Ceph file system, you do not need a " "metadata server." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:42 msgid "*Meta-Data Server (MDS)*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:45 msgid "" "A lightweight daemon that handles all communications with external " "applications and clients. It also provides a consensus for distributed " "decision making in a Ceph/RADOS cluster. For instance, when you mount a Ceph " "shared on a client, you point to the address of a MON server. It checks the " "state and the consistency of the data. In an ideal setup, you must run at " "least three ``ceph-mon`` daemons on separate servers." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:51 msgid "*Monitor (MON)*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:53 msgid "" "Ceph developers recommend XFS for production deployments, Btrfs for testing, " "development, and any non-critical deployments. Btrfs has the correct feature " "set and roadmap to serve Ceph in the long-term, but XFS and ext4 provide the " "necessary stability for today’s deployments." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:60 msgid "" "If using Btrfs, ensure that you use the correct version (see `Ceph " "Dependencies <http://ceph.com/docs/master/start/os-recommendations/.>`__)." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:63 msgid "" "For more information about usable file systems, see `ceph.com/ceph-storage/" "file-system/ <http://ceph.com/ceph-storage/file-system/>`__." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:67 msgid "Ways to store, use, and expose data" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:69 msgid "" "To store and access your data, you can use the following storage systems:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:73 msgid "*RADOS*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:73 msgid "Use as an object, default storage mechanism." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:76 msgid "" "Use as a block device. The Linux kernel RBD (RADOS block device) driver " "allows striping a Linux block device over multiple distributed object store " "data objects. It is compatible with the KVM RBD image." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:79 msgid "*RBD*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:82 msgid "*CephFS*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:82 msgid "Use as a file, POSIX-compliant file system." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:84 msgid "Ceph exposes RADOS; you can access it through the following interfaces:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:87 msgid "" "OpenStack Object Storage and Amazon-S3 compatible RESTful interface (see " "`RADOS_Gateway <http://ceph.com/wiki/RADOS_Gateway>`__)." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:89 msgid "*RADOS Gateway*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:92 msgid "*librados*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:92 msgid "and its related C/C++ bindings" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:95 msgid "" "Linux kernel and QEMU block devices that stripe data across multiple objects." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ceph-rbd-volume-driver.rst:96 msgid "*RBD and QEMU-RBD*" msgstr "" # The architecture consists of commodity storage servers " "with SDN ToR switches. Leveraging an SDN OpenFlow controller allows you to " "scale storage horizontally, while avoiding storage and network bottlenecks " "by intelligent load-balancing and parallelized workloads. High-performance " "PCIe NVMe flash, paired with traditional hard disk drives (HDD) or solid-" "state drives (SSD), delivers low-latency performance even with highly mixed " "workloads in large scale environment." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/coho-data-driver.rst:14 msgid "" "Coho Data's storage features include real-time instance level granularity " "performance and capacity reporting via API or UI, and single-IP storage " "endpoint access." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/coho-data-driver.rst:21 #: ../block-storage/drivers/pure-storage-driver.rst:28 #: Each entry " "consists of a unique section name, surrounded by square brackets, followed " "by options specified in ``key=value`` format." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:69 msgid "" "The ``dothill_backend_name`` value specifies the name of the storage pool or " "vdisk on the array." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:72 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hp-msa-driver.rst:70 msgid "" "The ``volume_backend_name`` option value can be a unique value, if you wish " "to be able to assign volumes to a specific storage pool on the array, or a " "name that is shared among multiple storage pools to let the volume scheduler " "choose where new volumes are allocated." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:77 msgid "" "The rest of the options will be repeated for each storage pool in a given " "array: the appropriate Cinder driver name; IP address or hostname of the " "array management interface; the username and password of an array user " "account with ``manage`` privileges; and the iSCSI IP addresses for the array " "if using the iSCSI transport protocol." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:83 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hp-msa-driver.rst:81 #: ../block-storage/drivers/lenovo-driver.rst:77 msgid "" "In the examples below, two back ends are defined, one for pool A and one for " "pool B, and a common ``volume_backend_name`` is used so that a single volume " "type definition can be used to allocate volumes from both pools." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:89 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hp-msa-driver.rst:85 msgid "**iSCSI example back-end entries**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:111 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hp-msa-driver.rst:107 msgid "**Fibre Channel example back-end entries**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:131 msgid "" "If any ``volume_backend_name`` value refers to a vdisk rather than a virtual " "pool, add an additional statement ``dothill_backend_type = linear`` to that " "back-end entry." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:135 msgid "" "If HTTPS is not enabled in the array, include ``dothill_api_protocol = " "http`` in each of the back-end definitions." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:138 msgid "" "If HTTPS is enabled, you can enable certificate verification with the option " "``dothill_verify_certificate=True``. You may also use the " "``dothill_verify_certificate_path`` parameter to specify the path to a CA" "\_BUNDLE file containing CAs other than those in the default list." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:143 #: ../block-storage/drivers/lenovo-driver.rst:132 msgid "" "Modify the ``[DEFAULT]`` section of the ``cinder.conf`` file to add an " "``enabled_backends`` parameter specifying the back-end entries you added, " "and a ``default_volume_type`` parameter specifying the name of a volume type " "that you will create in the next step." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:148 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hp-msa-driver.rst:144 msgid "**Example of [DEFAULT] section changes**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/dothill-driver.rst:158 msgid "" "Create a new volume type for each distinct ``volume_backend_name`` value " "that you added to cinder.conf. PortGroups can contain one or more port groups of either iSCSI " "or FC ports. When a dynamic masking view is created by the VMAX driver, the " "port group is chosen randomly from the PortGroup list, to evenly distribute " "load across the set of groups provided. Make sure that the PortGroups set " "contains either all FC or all iSCSI port groups (for a given back end), as " "appropriate for the configured driver (iSCSI or FC)." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vmax-driver.rst:181 msgid "``PortGroups``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vmax-driver.rst:184 msgid "Unique VMAX array serial number." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vmax-driver.rst:184 msgid "``Array``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vmax-driver.rst:187 msgid "" "Unique pool name within a given array. See the following " "sections for the detail of each option. Replace ``EMCCLIFCDriver`` with " "``EMCCLIISCSIDriver`` if you are using the iSCSI driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:169 msgid "" "For more details on multi-backends, see `OpenStack Cloud Administration " "Guide <http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/index.html>`__" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:173 msgid "Required configurations" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:175 msgid "**IP of the VNX Storage Processors**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:177 msgid "Specify the SP A and SP B IP to connect:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:184 msgid "**VNX login credentials**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:186 msgid "There are two ways to specify the credentials." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:188 msgid "Use plain text username and password." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:190 msgid "Supply for plain username and password:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:198 msgid "" "Valid values for ``storage_vnx_authentication_type`` are: ``global`` " "(default), ``local``, and ``ldap``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:201 msgid "Use Security file." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:203 msgid "" "This approach avoids the plain text password in your cinder configuration " "file. Supply a security file as below:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:210 msgid "" "Check Unisphere CLI user guide or :ref:`authenticate-by-security-file` for " "how to create a security file." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:213 msgid "**Path to your Unisphere CLI**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:215 msgid "Specify the absolute path to your naviseccli:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:221 msgid "**Driver name**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:223 msgid "For the FC Driver, add the following option:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:229 msgid "For iSCSI Driver, add the following option:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:236 msgid "Optional configurations" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:239 msgid "VNX pool names" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:241 msgid "" "Specify the list of pools to be managed, separated by commas. They should " "already exist in VNX." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:248 msgid "If this value is not specified, all pools of the array will be used." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:250 msgid "**Initiator auto registration**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:252 msgid "" "When ``initiator_auto_registration`` is set to ``True``, the driver will " "automatically register initiators to all working target ports of the VNX " "array during volume attaching (The driver will skip those initiators that " "have already been registered) if the option ``io_port_list`` is not " "specified in the ``cinder.conf`` file." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:258 msgid "" "If the user wants to register the initiators with some specific ports but " "not register with the other ports, this functionality should be disabled." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:261 msgid "" "When a comma-separated list is given to ``io_port_list``, the driver will " "only register the initiator to the ports specified in the list and only " "return target port(s) which belong to the target ports in the " "``io_port_list`` instead of all target ports." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:266 msgid "Example for FC ports:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:272 msgid "" "``a`` or ``B`` is *Storage Processor*, number ``1`` and ``3`` are *Port ID*." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:275 msgid "Example for iSCSI ports:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:281 msgid "" "``a`` or ``B`` is *Storage Processor*, the first numbers ``1`` and ``3`` are " "*Port ID* and the second number ``0`` is *Virtual Port ID*" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:286 msgid "" "Rather than de-registered, the registered ports will be simply bypassed " "whatever they are in ``io_port_list`` or not." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:289 msgid "" "The driver will raise an exception if ports in ``io_port_list`` do not exist " "in VNX during startup." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:293 msgid "Force delete volumes in storage group" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:295 msgid "" "Some ``available`` volumes may remain in storage group on the VNX array due " "to some OpenStack timeout issue. But the VNX array do not allow the user to " "delete the volumes which are in storage group. Option " "``force_delete_lun_in_storagegroup`` is introduced to allow the user to " "delete the ``available`` volumes in this tricky situation." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:301 msgid "" "When ``force_delete_lun_in_storagegroup`` is set to ``True`` in the back-end " "section, the driver will move the volumes out of the storage groups and then " "delete them if the user tries to delete the volumes that remain in the " "storage group on the VNX array." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:306 msgid "The default value of ``force_delete_lun_in_storagegroup`` is ``False``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:309 msgid "Over subscription in thin provisioning" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:311 msgid "" "Over subscription allows that the sum of all volume's capacity (provisioned " "capacity) to be larger than the pool's total capacity." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:314 msgid "" "``max_over_subscription_ratio`` in the back-end section is the ratio of " "provisioned capacity over total capacity." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:317 msgid "" "The default value of ``max_over_subscription_ratio`` is 20.0, which means " "the provisioned capacity can not exceed the total capacity. If the value of " "this ratio is set larger than 1.0, the provisioned capacity can exceed the " "total capacity." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:323 msgid "Storage group automatic deletion" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:325 msgid "" "For volume attaching, the driver has a storage group on VNX for each compute " "node hosting the vm instances which are going to consume VNX Block Storage " "(using compute node's host name as storage group's name). All the volumes " "attached to the VM instances in a Compute node will be put into the storage " "group. If ``destroy_empty_storage_group`` is set to ``True``, the driver " "will remove the empty storage group after its last volume is detached. For " "data safety, it does not suggest to set ``destroy_empty_storage_group=True`` " "unless the VNX is exclusively managed by one Block Storage node because " "consistent ``lock_path`` is required for operation synchronization for this " "behavior." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:336 msgid "Initiator auto deregistration" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:338 msgid "" "Enabling storage group automatic deletion is the precondition of this " "function. If ``initiator_auto_deregistration`` is set to ``True`` is set, " "the driver will deregister all the initiators of the host after its storage " "group is deleted." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:343 msgid "FC SAN auto zoning" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:345 msgid "" "The EMC VNX FC driver supports FC SAN auto zoning when ``ZoneManager`` is " "configured. Set ``zoning_mode`` to ``fabric`` in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section " "to enable this feature. For ZoneManager configuration, refer to Block " "Storage official guide." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:351 msgid "Volume number threshold" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:353 msgid "" "In VNX, there is a limitation on the number of pool volumes that can be " "created in the system. When the limitation is reached, no more pool volumes " "can be created even if there is remaining capacity in the storage pool. In " "other words, if the scheduler dispatches a volume creation request to a back " "end that has free capacity but reaches the volume limitation, the creation " "fails." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:359 msgid "" "The default value of ``check_max_pool_luns_threshold`` is ``False``. When " "``check_max_pool_luns_threshold=True``, the pool-based back end will check " "the limit and will report 0 free capacity to the scheduler if the limit is " "reached. So the scheduler will be able to skip this kind of pool-based back " "end that runs out of the pool volume number." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:366 msgid "iSCSI initiators" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:368 msgid "" "``iscsi_initiators`` is a dictionary of IP addresses of the iSCSI initiator " "ports on OpenStack Compute and Block Storage nodes which want to connect to " "VNX via iSCSI. If this option is configured, the driver will leverage this " "information to find an accessible iSCSI target portal for the initiator when " "attaching volume. Otherwise, the iSCSI target portal will be chosen in a " "relative random way." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:377 msgid "This option is only valid for iSCSI driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:379 msgid "" "Here is an example. VNX will connect ``host1`` with ``10.0.0.1`` and " "``10.0.0.2``. And it will connect ``host2`` with ``10.0.0.3``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:382 msgid "" "The key name (``host1`` in the example) should be the output of :command:" "`hostname` command." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:390 msgid "Default timeout" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:392 msgid "" "Specify the timeout in minutes for operations like LUN migration, LUN " "creation, etc. For example, LUN migration is a typical long running " "operation, which depends on the LUN size and the load of the array. An upper " "bound in the specific deployment can be set to avoid unnecessary long wait." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:397 msgid "The default value for this option is ``infinite``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:404 msgid "Max LUNs per storage group" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:406 msgid "" "The ``max_luns_per_storage_group`` specify the maximum number of LUNs in a " "storage group. Default value is 255. It is also the maximum value supported " "by VNX." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:411 msgid "Ignore pool full threshold" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:413 msgid "" "If ``ignore_pool_full_threshold`` is set to ``True``, driver will force LUN " "creation even if the full threshold of pool is reached. Default to ``False``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:419 msgid "" "Extra specs are used in volume types created in Block Storage as the " "preferred property of the volume." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:422 msgid "" "The Block Storage scheduler will use extra specs to find the suitable back " "end for the volume and the Block Storage driver will create the volume based " "on the properties specified by the extra spec." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:426 msgid "Use the following command to create a volume type:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:432 msgid "Use the following command to update the extra spec of a volume type:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:438 msgid "The following sections describe the VNX extra keys." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:441 msgid "Provisioning type" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:443 msgid "Key: ``provisioning:type``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:445 msgid "Possible Values:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:447 #: ../block-storage/drivers/vmware-vmdk-driver.rst:95 msgid "``thick``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:449 msgid "Volume is fully provisioned." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:451 msgid "Run the following commands to create a ``thick`` volume type:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:458 #: ../block-storage/drivers/vmware-vmdk-driver.rst:92 msgid "``thin``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:460 msgid "Volume is virtually provisioned." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:462 msgid "Run the following commands to create a ``thin`` volume type:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:469 msgid "``deduplicated``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:471 msgid "" "Volume is ``thin`` and deduplication is enabled. The administrator shall go " "to VNX to configure the system level deduplication settings. To create a " "deduplicated volume, the VNX Deduplication license must be activated on VNX, " "and specify ``deduplication_support=True`` to let Block Storage scheduler " "find the proper volume back end." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:477 msgid "Run the following commands to create a ``deduplicated`` volume type:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:484 msgid "``compressed``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:486 msgid "" "Volume is ``thin`` and compression is enabled. The administrator shall go to " "the VNX to configure the system level compression settings. To create a " "compressed volume, the VNX Compression license must be activated on VNX, and " "use ``compression_support=True`` to let Block Storage scheduler find a " "volume back end. VNX does not support creating snapshots on a compressed " "volume." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:493 msgid "Run the following commands to create a ``compressed`` volume type:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:500 msgid "Default: ``thick``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:504 msgid "" "``provisioning:type`` replaces the old spec key ``storagetype:" "provisioning``. The latter one will be obsoleted in the next release. If " "both ``provisioning:type`` and ``storagetype:provisioning`` are set in the " "volume type, the value of ``provisioning:type`` will be used." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:511 msgid "Storage tiering support" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:513 msgid "Key: ``storagetype:tiering``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:515 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:553 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:570 msgid "Possible values:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:517 msgid "``StartHighThenAuto``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:519 msgid "``Auto``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:521 msgid "``HighestAvailable``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:523 msgid "``LowestAvailable``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:525 msgid "``NoMovement``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:527 msgid "Default: ``StartHighThenAuto``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:529 msgid "" "VNX supports fully automated storage tiering which requires the FAST license " "activated on the VNX. The OpenStack administrator can use the extra spec key " "``storagetype:tiering`` to set the tiering policy of a volume and use the " "key ``fast_support='<is> True'`` to let Block Storage scheduler find a " "volume back end which manages a VNX with FAST license activated. Here are " "the five supported values for the extra spec key ``storagetype:tiering``:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:536 msgid "Run the following commands to create a volume type with tiering policy:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:545 msgid "" "The tiering policy cannot be applied to a deduplicated volume. Tiering " "policy of the deduplicated LUN align with the settings of the pool." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:551 msgid "Key: ``fast_cache_enabled``" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# tables.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:555 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:572 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:235 #: ../block-storage/drivers/ibm-flashsystem-volume-driver.rst:111 #: ../block-storage/drivers/ibm-flashsystem-volume-driver.rst:184 #: ../tables/conf-changes/neutron.rst:82 ../tables/conf-changes/trove.rst:79 msgid "``True``" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# tables.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:557 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:574 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:256 #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:260 #: ../tables/conf-changes/neutron.rst:81 ../tables/conf-changes/nova.rst:30 #: ../tables/conf-changes/trove.rst:80 msgid "``False``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:559 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:576 msgid "Default: ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:561 msgid "" "VNX has FAST Cache feature which requires the FAST Cache license activated " "on the VNX. Volume will be created on the backend with FAST cache enabled " "when ``True`` is specified." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:566 msgid "Snap-copy" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:568 msgid "Key: ``copytype:snap``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:578 msgid "" "The VNX driver supports snap-copy, which extremely accelerates the process " "for creating a copied volume." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:581 msgid "" "By default, the driver will do a full data copy while creating a volume from " "a snapshot or cloning a volume, which is time-consuming especially for large " "volumes. When the snap-copy is used, the driver will simply create a " "snapshot and mount it as a volume for the two types of operations which will " "be instant even for large volumes." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:587 msgid "" "To enable this functionality, the source volume should have ``copytype:" "snap=True`` in the extra specs of its volume type. Then the new volume " "cloned from the source or copied from the snapshot for the source, will be " "in fact a snap-copy instead of a full copy. If a full copy is needed, retype/" "migration can be used to convert the snap-copy volume to a full-copy volume " "which may be time-consuming." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:599 msgid "" "User can determine whether the volume is a snap-copy volume or not by " "showing its metadata. If the ``lun_type`` in metadata is ``smp``, the volume " "is a snap-copy volume. Otherwise, it is a full-copy volume." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:607 #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:669 msgid "**Constraints**" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:609 msgid "" "``copytype:snap=True`` is not allowed in the volume type of a consistency " "group." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:612 msgid "" "Clone and snapshot creation are not allowed on a copied volume created " "through the snap-copy before it is converted to a full copy." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:615 msgid "" "The number of snap-copy volume created from a source volume is limited to " "255 at one point in time." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:618 msgid "The source volume which has snap-copy volume can not be deleted." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:621 msgid "Pool name" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:623 msgid "Key: ``pool_name``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:625 msgid "Possible values: name of the storage pool managed by cinder" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:627 msgid "Default: None" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:629 msgid "" "If the user wants to create a volume on a certain storage pool in a back end " "that manages multiple pools, a volume type with a extra spec specified " "storage pool should be created first, then the user can use this volume type " "to create the volume." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:634 msgid "Run the following commands to create the volume type:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:643 msgid "Advanced features" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:646 msgid "Read-only volumes" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:648 msgid "" "OpenStack supports read-only volumes. The following command can be used to " "set a volume as read-only." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:655 msgid "" "After a volume is marked as read-only, the driver will forward the " "information when a hypervisor is attaching the volume and the hypervisor " "will make sure the volume is read-only." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:660 msgid "Efficient non-disruptive volume backup" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:662 msgid "" "The default implementation in Block Storage for non-disruptive volume backup " "is not efficient since a cloned volume will be created during backup." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:665 msgid "" "The approach of efficient backup is to create a snapshot for the volume and " "connect this snapshot (a mount point in VNX) to the Block Storage host for " "volume backup. This eliminates migration time involved in volume clone." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:671 msgid "" "Backup creation for a snap-copy volume is not allowed if the volume status " "is ``in-use`` since snapshot cannot be taken from this volume." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:675 msgid "Best practice" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:680 msgid "Multipath setup" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:682 msgid "" "Enabling multipath volume access is recommended for robust data access. The " "major configuration includes:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:685 msgid "" "Install ``multipath-tools``, ``sysfsutils`` and ``sg3-utils`` on the nodes " "hosting Nova-Compute and Cinder-Volume services. Check the operating system " "manual for the system distribution for specific installation steps. For Red " "Hat based distributions, they should be ``device-mapper-multipath``, " "``sysfsutils`` and ``sg3_utils``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:691 msgid "" "Specify ``use_multipath_for_image_xfer=true`` in the ``cinder.conf`` file " "for each FC/iSCSI back end." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:694 msgid "" "Specify ``iscsi_use_multipath=True`` in ``libvirt`` section of the ``nova." "conf`` file. This option is valid for both iSCSI and FC driver." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:697 msgid "" "For multipath-tools, here is an EMC recommended sample of ``/etc/multipath." "conf`` file." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:700 msgid "" "``user_friendly_names`` is not specified in the configuration and thus it " "will take the default value ``no``. It is not recommended to set it to " "``yes`` because it may fail operations such as VM live migration." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:743 msgid "" "When multipath is used in OpenStack, multipath faulty devices may come out " "in Nova-Compute nodes due to different issues (`Bug 1336683 <https://bugs." "launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1336683>`__ is a typical example)." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:748 msgid "" "A solution to completely avoid faulty devices has not been found yet. " "``faulty_device_cleanup.py`` mitigates this issue when VNX iSCSI storage is " "used. Cloud administrators can deploy the script in all Nova-Compute nodes " "and use a CRON job to run the script on each Nova-Compute node periodically " "so that faulty devices will not stay too long. Refer to: `VNX faulty device " "cleanup <https://github.com/emc-openstack/vnx-faulty-device-cleanup>`__ for " "detailed usage and the script." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:757 msgid "Restrictions and limitations" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:760 msgid "iSCSI port cache" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:762 msgid "" "EMC VNX iSCSI driver caches the iSCSI ports information, so that the user " "should restart the ``cinder-volume`` service or wait for seconds (which is " "configured by ``periodic_interval`` in the ``cinder.conf`` file) before any " "volume attachment operation after changing the iSCSI port configurations. " "Otherwise the attachment may fail because the old iSCSI port configurations " "were used." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:770 msgid "No extending for volume with snapshots" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:772 msgid "" "VNX does not support extending the thick volume which has a snapshot. If the " "user tries to extend a volume which has a snapshot, the status of the volume " "would change to ``error_extending``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:777 msgid "Limitations for deploying cinder on computer node" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:779 msgid "" "It is not recommended to deploy the driver on a compute node if ``cinder " "upload-to-image --force True`` is used against an in-use volume. Otherwise, " "``cinder upload-to-image --force True`` will terminate the data access of " "the vm instance to the volume." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:785 msgid "Storage group with host names in VNX" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:787 msgid "" "When the driver notices that there is no existing storage group that has the " "host name as the storage group name, it will create the storage group and " "also add the compute node's or Block Storage node's registered initiators " "into the storage group." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:792 msgid "" "If the driver notices that the storage group already exists, it will assume " "that the registered initiators have also been put into it and skip the " "operations above for better performance." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:796 msgid "" "It is recommended that the storage administrator does not create the storage " "group manually and instead relies on the driver for the preparation. If the " "storage administrator needs to create the storage group manually for some " "special requirements, the correct registered initiators should be put into " "the storage group as well (otherwise the following volume attaching " "operations will fail)." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:804 msgid "EMC storage-assisted volume migration" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:806 msgid "" "EMC VNX driver supports storage-assisted volume migration, when the user " "starts migrating with ``cinder migrate --force-host-copy False <volume_id> " "<host>`` or ``cinder migrate <volume_id> <host>``, cinder will try to " "leverage the VNX's native volume migration functionality." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:811 msgid "" "In following scenarios, VNX storage-assisted volume migration will not be " "triggered:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:814 msgid "" "Volume migration between back ends with different storage protocol, for " "example, FC and iSCSI." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:817 msgid "Volume is to be migrated across arrays." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:820 msgid "Appendix" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:825 msgid "Authenticate by security file" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:827 msgid "" "VNX credentials are necessary when the driver connects to the VNX system. " "Credentials in ``global``, ``local`` and ``ldap`` scopes are supported. " "There are two approaches to provide the credentials." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:831 msgid "" "The recommended one is using the Navisphere CLI security file to provide the " "credentials which can get rid of providing the plain text credentials in the " "configuration file. Following is the instruction on how to do this." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/emc-vnx-driver.rst:835 msgid "" "Find out the Linux user id of the ``cinder-volume`` processes. Additionally:" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:33 msgid "" "Create NFS exports, choose a path for them (it must be different from ``/``) " "and set the :guilabel:`Show snapshots` option to ``hide and disable access``." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:37 msgid "" "Also, in the ``Access Configuration`` set the option ``norootsquash``, For " "example, ``"* (rw, norootsquash)"``, so HNAS cinder driver can change the " "permissions of its volumes." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:41 msgid "" "In order to use the hardware accelerated features of NFS HNAS, we recommend " "setting ``max-nfs-version`` to 3. "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:187 msgid "``default``" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/hds-hnas-driver.rst:188 msgid "" "When a ``create_volume`` call with a certain volume type happens, the volume " "type will try to be matched up with this tag. In each configuration file you " "must define the ``default`` volume type in the service labels and, if no " "volume type is specified, the ``default`` is used. Other labels are case " "sensitive and should match exactly. This scenario occurs during migration of a virtual machine with an " "attached volume; the volume is simultaneously mapped to both the source and " "destination compute hosts. If your deployment does not require attaching " "vdisks to multiple hosts, setting this flag to ``False`` will provide added " "safety." msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ibm-flashsystem-volume-driver.rst:123 msgid "IBM FlashSystem iSCSI driver" msgstr "" #: ../block-storage/drivers/ibm-flashsystem-volume-driver.rst:128 msgid "" "Using iSCSI, each FlashSystem node should have at least one iSCSI port " "configured. iSCSI IP addresses of IBM FlashSystem can be obtained by " "FlashSystem GUI or CLI.
