options" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/misc.rst:5 msgid "These options can also be set in the ``manila.conf`` file." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:3 msgid "Introduction to the Shared File Systems service" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:5 msgid "" "The Shared File Systems service provides shared file systems that Compute " "instances can consume." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:8 msgid "The Shared File Systems service provides:" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:11 msgid "" "A WSGI app that authenticates and routes requests throughout the Shared File " "Systems service. It supports the OpenStack APIs." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:13 msgid "manila-api" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:16 msgid "" "Schedules and routes requests to the appropriate share service. The " "scheduler uses configurable filters and weighers to route requests. The " "Filter Scheduler is the default and enables filters on things like Capacity, " "Availability Zone, Share Types, and Capabilities as well as custom filters." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:20 msgid "manila-scheduler" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:23 msgid "" "Manages back-end devices that provide shared file systems. A manila-share " "service can run in one of two modes, with or without handling of share " "servers. Share servers export file shares via share networks. When share " "servers are not used, the networking requirements are handled outside of " "Manila." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:27 msgid "manila-share" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:29 msgid "The Shared File Systems service contains the following components:" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:32 msgid "" "The Shared File Services service requires some form of back-end shared file " "system provider that the service is built on. The reference implementation " "uses the Block Storage service (Cinder) and a service VM to provide shares. " "Additional drivers are used to access shared file systems from a variety of " "vendor solutions." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:36 msgid "**Back-end storage devices**" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:39 msgid "" "The Shared File Systems service can be used by many different cloud " "computing consumers or customers (tenants on a shared system), using role-" "based access assignments. Roles control the actions that a user is allowed " "to perform. In the default configuration, most actions do not require a " "particular role unless they are restricted to administrators, but this can " "be configured by the system administrator in the appropriate ``policy.json`` " "file that maintains the rules. A user's access to manage particular shares " "is limited by tenant. Guest access to mount and use shares is secured by IP " "and/or user access rules. Quotas used to control resource consumption across " "available hardware resources are per tenant." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:52 msgid "The number of shares that can be created." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:54 msgid "The number of gigabytes that can be provisioned for shares." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:56 msgid "The number of share snapshots that can be created." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:58 msgid "The number of gigabytes that can be provisioned for share snapshots." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:61 msgid "The number of share networks that can be created." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:63 msgid "" "You can revise the default quota values with the Shared File Systems CLI, so " "the limits placed by quotas are editable by admin users." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:64 msgid "**Users and tenants (projects)**" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:67 msgid "" "The basic resources offered by the Shared File Systems service are shares, " "snapshots and share networks:" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:71 msgid "" "A share is a unit of storage with a protocol, a size, and an access list. " "Shares are the basic primitive provided by Manila. All shares exist on a " "backend. Some shares are associated with share networks and share servers. " "The main protocols supported are NFS and CIFS, but other protocols are " "supported as well." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:75 msgid "**Shares**" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:78 msgid "" "A snapshot is a point in time copy of a share. Snapshots can only be used " "to create new shares (containing the snapshotted data). Shares cannot be " "deleted until all associated snapshots are deleted." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:80 msgid "**Snapshots**" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:83 msgid "" "A share network is a tenant-defined object that informs Manila about the " "security and network configuration for a group of shares. Share networks are " "only relevant for backends that manage share servers. A share network " "contains a security service and network/subnet." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:85 msgid "**Share networks**" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/overview.rst:85 msgid "**Shares, snapshots, and share networks**" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/rpc.rst:0 msgid "Description of QPID configuration options" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/rpc.rst:11 msgid "" "The following tables contain settings to configure the messaging middleware " "for the Shared File System service:" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:3 msgid "Shared File Systems sample configuration files" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:5 msgid "All the files in this section can be found in ``/etc/manila``." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:8 msgid "manila.conf" msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:10 msgid "" "The ``manila.conf`` file is installed in ``/etc/manila`` by default. When " "you manually install the Shared File Systems service, the options in the " "``manila.conf`` file are set to default values." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:14 msgid "" "The ``manila.conf`` file contains most of the options to configure the " "Shared File Systems service." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:23 msgid "" "Use the ``api-paste.ini`` file to configure the Shared File Systems API " "service." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:33 msgid "" "The ``policy.json`` file defines additional access controls that apply to " "the Shared File Systems service." msgstr "" #: ../shared-file-systems/sample-configuration-files.rst:43 msgid "" "The ``rootwrap.conf`` file defines configuration values used by the " "``rootwrap`` script when the Shared File Systems service must escalate its " "privileges to those of the root user." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# database-service.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# data-processing-service.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# identity.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# image-service.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# messaging.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# networking.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# object-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# orchestration.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# shared-file-systems.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# telemetry.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# If set to auto, a check is done to determine if this is a new " "installation: True is used if so, otherwise False. Default is auto." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-nas.rst:33 msgid "``nas_secure_file_permissions`` = ``auto``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-nas.rst:34 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Set more secure file permissions on network-attached storage volume " "files to restrict broad other/world access. If set to False, volumes are " "created with open permissions. If set to True, volumes are created with " "permissions for the cinder user and group (660). If set to auto, a check is " "done to determine if this is a new installation: True is used if so, " "otherwise False. Default is auto." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-nas.rst:35 msgid "``nas_share_path`` =" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-nas.rst:36 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Path to the share to use for storing Cinder volumes. If not specified, Data ONTAP drivers will use 80 for HTTP and " "443 for HTTPS; E-Series will use 8080 for HTTP and 8443 for HTTPS." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_iscsi.rst:33 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:37 msgid "``netapp_size_multiplier`` = ``1.2``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_iscsi.rst:34 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:38 msgid "" "(FloatOpt) The quantity to be multiplied by the requested volume size to " "ensure enough space is available on the virtual storage server (Vserver) to " "fulfill the volume creation request. valid values " "are ontap_7mode for using Data ONTAP operating in 7-Mode, ontap_cluster for " "using clustered Data ONTAP, or eseries for using E-Series." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_iscsi.rst:37 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:37 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:41 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:45 msgid "``netapp_storage_protocol`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_iscsi.rst:38 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:38 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:42 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:46 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The storage protocol to be used on the data path with the storage " "system." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# block-storage.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# shared-file-systems.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_iscsi.rst:39 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:39 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:43 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:47 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_eseries_iscsi.rst:43 ../tables/manila-netapp.rst:43 msgid "``netapp_transport_type`` = ``http``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_iscsi.rst:40 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:40 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:44 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:48 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_eseries_iscsi.rst:44 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The transport protocol used when communicating with the storage " "system or proxy server." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_iscsi.rst:41 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:41 msgid "``netapp_vfiler`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_iscsi.rst:42 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:42 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The vFiler unit on which provisioning of block storage volumes will " "be done. This option is only used by the driver when connecting to an " "instance with a storage family of Data ONTAP operating in 7-Mode. Only use " "this option when utilizing the MultiStore feature on the NetApp storage " "system." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:21 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:21 msgid "``expiry_thres_minutes`` = ``720``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:22 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:22 msgid "" "(IntOpt) This option specifies the threshold for last access time for images " "in the NFS image cache. When a cache cleaning cycle begins, images in the " "cache that have not been accessed in the last M minutes, where M is the " "value of this parameter, will be deleted from the cache to create free space " "on the NFS share." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:43 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:51 msgid "``thres_avl_size_perc_start`` = ``20``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:44 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:52 msgid "" "(IntOpt) If the percentage of available space for an NFS share has dropped " "below the value specified by this option, the NFS image cache will be " "cleaned." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:45 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:53 msgid "``thres_avl_size_perc_stop`` = ``60``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_7mode_nfs.rst:46 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:54 msgid "" "(IntOpt) When the percentage of available space on an NFS share has reached " "the percentage specified by this option, the driver will stop clearing files " "from the NFS image cache that have not been accessed in the last M minutes, " "where M is the value of the expiry_thres_minutes configuration option." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:23 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:31 msgid "``netapp_lun_ostype`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:24 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:32 msgid "" "(StrOpt) This option defines the type of operating system that will access a " "LUN exported from Data ONTAP; it is assigned to the LUN at the time it is " "created." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:25 msgid "``netapp_lun_space_reservation`` = ``enabled``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:26 msgid "" "(StrOpt) This option determines if storage space is reserved for LUN " "allocation. If enabled, LUNs are thick provisioned. If space reservation is " "disabled, storage space is allocated on demand." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:45 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:49 msgid "``netapp_vserver`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_iscsi.rst:46 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:50 msgid "" "(StrOpt) This option specifies the virtual storage server (Vserver) name on " "the storage cluster on which provisioning of block storage volumes should " "occur." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:23 msgid "``netapp_copyoffload_tool_path`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:24 msgid "" "(StrOpt) This option specifies the path of the NetApp copy offload tool " "binary. Ensure that the binary has execute permissions set which allow the " "effective user of the cinder-volume process to execute the file." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:25 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:27 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_eseries_iscsi.rst:25 msgid "``netapp_host_type`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:26 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_cdot_nfs.rst:28 #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_eseries_iscsi.rst:26 msgid "" "(StrOpt) This option defines the type of operating system for all initiators " "that can access a LUN. An example would be live " "migration of servers that have volumes attached. When enabled, this backend " "is limited to 256 total volumes in order to guarantee volumes can be " "accessed by more than one host." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_eseries_iscsi.rst:35 msgid "``netapp_sa_password`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_eseries_iscsi.rst:36 msgid "(StrOpt) Password for the NetApp E-Series storage array." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_eseries_iscsi.rst:45 msgid "``netapp_webservice_path`` = ``/devmgr/v2``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-netapp_eseries_iscsi.rst:46 msgid "" "(StrOpt) This option is used to specify the path to the E-Series proxy " "application on a proxy server. These backend names should be " "backed by a unique [CONFIG] group with its options" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage.rst:27 msgid "``iscsi_helper`` = ``tgtadm``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage.rst:28 msgid "" "(StrOpt) iSCSI target user-land tool to use. tgtadm is default, use lioadm " "for LIO iSCSI support, scstadmin for SCST target support, iseradm for the " "ISER protocol, ietadm for iSCSI Enterprise Target, iscsictl for Chelsio " "iSCSI Target or fake for testing." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage.rst:29 msgid "``iscsi_iotype`` = ``fileio``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage.rst:30 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Sets the behavior of the iSCSI target to either perform blockio or " "fileio optionally, auto can be set and Cinder will autodetect type of " "backing device" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage.rst:31 msgid "``iscsi_ip_address`` = ``$my_ip``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage.rst:32 msgid "(StrOpt) The IP address that the iSCSI daemon is listening on" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage.rst:35 msgid "``iscsi_protocol`` = ``iscsi``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage.rst:36 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Determines the iSCSI protocol for new iSCSI volumes, created with " "tgtadm or lioadm target helpers. Set this when the " "Image service repository also uses GPFS so that image files can be " "transferred efficiently from the Image service to the Block Storage service. " "There are two valid values: "copy" specifies that a full copy of the image " "is made; "copy_on_write" specifies that copy-on-write optimization " "strategy is used and unmodified blocks of the image file are shared " "efficiently." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage_gpfs.rst:25 msgid "``gpfs_max_clone_depth`` = ``0``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage_gpfs.rst:26 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Specifies an upper limit on the number of indirections required to " "reach a specific block due to snapshots or clones. A lengthy chain of copy-" "on-write snapshots or clones can have a negative impact on performance, but " "improves space utilization. 0 indicates unlimited clone depth." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage_gpfs.rst:27 msgid "``gpfs_mount_point_base`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage_gpfs.rst:28 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Specifies the path of the GPFS directory where Block Storage volume " "and snapshot files are stored." msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage_gpfs.rst:29 msgid "``gpfs_sparse_volumes`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/cinder-storage_gpfs.rst:30 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Specifies that volumes are created as sparse files which initially " "consume no space. This includes, if " "used, Swift or S3 credentials. Should be set to a random string of length " "16, 24 or 32 bytes" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:51 msgid "``metadata_source_path`` = ``/etc/glance/metadefs/``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:52 msgid "(StrOpt) Path to the directory where json metadata files are stored" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:53 msgid "``property_protection_file`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:54 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The location of the property protection file.This file contains the " "rules for property protections and the roles/policies associated with it. If " "this config value is not specified, by default, property protections won't " "be enforced. If a value is specified and the file is not found, then the " "glance-api service will not start." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:55 msgid "``property_protection_rule_format`` = ``roles``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:56 msgid "" "(StrOpt) This config value indicates whether "roles" or "policies" are " "used in the property protection file." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:57 msgid "``show_image_direct_url`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:58 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Whether to include the backend image storage location in image " "properties. Revealing storage location can be a security risk, so use this " "setting with caution!" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:59 msgid "``user_storage_quota`` = ``0``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:60 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Set a system wide quota for every user. Accepted units are " "B, KB, MB, GB and TB representing Bytes, KiloBytes, MegaBytes, GigaBytes and " "TeraBytes respectively. If no unit is specified then Bytes is assumed. Note " "that there should not be any space between value and unit and units are case " "sensitive." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:61 msgid "``workers`` = ``4``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:62 msgid "" "(IntOpt) The number of child process workers that will be created to service " "requests. The default will be equal to the number of CPUs available." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:67 msgid "**[image_format]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:69 msgid "``container_formats`` = ``ami, ari, aki, bare, ovf, ova, docker``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:70 msgid "(ListOpt) Supported values for the 'container_format' image attribute" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:71 msgid "``disk_formats`` = ``ami, ari, aki, vhd, vmdk, raw, qcow2, vdi, iso``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:72 msgid "(ListOpt) Supported values for the 'disk_format' image attribute" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:77 msgid "**[task]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:79 msgid "``task_executor`` = ``taskflow``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:80 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Specifies which task executor to be used to run the task scripts." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:81 msgid "``task_time_to_live`` = ``48``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:82 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Time in hours for which a task lives after, either succeeding or " "failing" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:83 msgid "``work_dir`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-common.rst:84 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Work dir for asynchronous task operations. The directory set here " "will be used to operate over images - normally before they are imported in " "the destination store. When providing work dir, make sure enough space is " "provided for concurrent tasks to run efficiently without running out of " "space. A rough estimation can be done by multiplying the number of " "`max_workers` - or the N of workers running - by an average image size (e.g " "500MB). The image size estimation should be done based on the average size " "in your deployment. Note that depending on the tasks running you may need to " "multiply this number by some factor depending on what the task does. For " "example, you may want to double the available size if image conversion is " "enabled. All this being said, remember these are just estimations and you " "should do them based on the worst case scenario and be prepared to act in " "case they were wrong." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-filesystem.rst:21 msgid "``filesystem_store_datadir`` = ``/var/lib/glance/images``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-filesystem.rst:22 msgid "(StrOpt) Directory to which the Filesystem backend store writes images." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-filesystem.rst:23 msgid "``filesystem_store_datadirs`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-filesystem.rst:24 msgid "" "(MultiStrOpt) List of directories and its priorities to which the Filesystem " "backend store writes images." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-filesystem.rst:25 msgid "``filesystem_store_file_perm`` = ``0``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-filesystem.rst:26 msgid "" "(IntOpt) The required permission for created image file. In this way the " "user other service used, e.g. Nova, who consumes the image could be the " "exclusive member of the group that owns the files created. Assigning it less " "then or equal to zero means don't change the default permission of the file. " "This value will be decoded as an octal digit." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-filesystem.rst:27 msgid "``filesystem_store_metadata_file`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-filesystem.rst:28 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The path to a file which contains the metadata to be returned with " "any location associated with this store. The file must contain a valid JSON " "object. The object should contain the keys 'id' and 'mountpoint'. The value " "for both keys should be 'string'." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:21 msgid "``delayed_delete`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:22 msgid "(BoolOpt) Turn on/off delayed delete." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:23 msgid "``image_cache_dir`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:24 msgid "(StrOpt) Base directory that the image cache uses." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:25 msgid "``image_cache_driver`` = ``sqlite``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:26 msgid "(StrOpt) The driver to use for image cache management." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:27 msgid "``image_cache_max_size`` = ``10737418240``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:28 msgid "" "(IntOpt) The upper limit (the maximum size of accumulated cache in bytes) " "beyond which the cache pruner, if running, starts cleaning the image cache." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:29 msgid "``image_cache_sqlite_db`` = ``cache.db``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:30 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The path to the sqlite file database that will be used for image " "cache management." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:31 msgid "``image_cache_stall_time`` = ``86400``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:32 msgid "" "(IntOpt) The amount of time to let an incomplete image remain in the cache, " "before the cache cleaner, if running, will remove the incomplete image." msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:33 msgid "``scrub_pool_size`` = ``1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/glance-imagecache.rst:34 msgid "" "(IntOpt) The size of thread pool to be used for scrubbing images. An optional weight may be given after the datastore name, " "seperated again by ":". Thus, the required format becomes " "<datacenter_path>:<datastore_name>:<optional_weight>. When adding an image, " "the datastore with highest weight will be selected, unless there is not " "enough free space available in cases where the image size is already known. All stacks with this " "option will be created using convergence engine ." msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:23 msgid "``default_deployment_signal_transport`` = ``CFN_SIGNAL``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:24 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Template default for how the server should signal to heat with the " "deployment output values. CFN_SIGNAL will allow an HTTP POST to a CFN " "keypair signed URL (requires enabled heat-api-cfn). TEMP_URL_SIGNAL will " "create a Swift TempURL to be signaled via HTTP PUT (requires object-store " "endpoint which supports TempURL). HEAT_SIGNAL will allow calls to the Heat " "API resource-signal using the provided keystone credentials. ZAQAR_SIGNAL " "will create a dedicated zaqar queue to be signaled using the provided " "keystone credentials." msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:25 msgid "``default_software_config_transport`` = ``POLL_SERVER_CFN``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:26 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Template default for how the server should receive the metadata " "required for software configuration. POLL_SERVER_CFN will allow calls to the " "cfn API action DescribeStackResource authenticated with the provided keypair " "(requires enabled heat-api-cfn). POLL_SERVER_HEAT will allow calls to the " "Heat API resource-show using the provided keystone credentials (requires " "keystone v3 API, and configured stack_user_* config options). POLL_TEMP_URL " "will create and populate a Swift TempURL with metadata for polling (requires " "object-store endpoint which supports TempURL).ZAQAR_MESSAGE will create a " "dedicated zaqar queue and post the metadata for polling." msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:27 msgid "``deferred_auth_method`` = ``trusts``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:28 msgid "(StrOpt) Select deferred auth method, stored password or trusts." msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:29 msgid "``environment_dir`` = ``/etc/heat/environment.d``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:30 msgid "(StrOpt) The directory to search for environment files." msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:31 msgid "``error_wait_time`` = ``240``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:32 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Error wait time in seconds for stack action (ie. create or update)." msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:33 msgid "``event_purge_batch_size`` = ``10``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/heat-common.rst:34 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Controls how many events will be pruned whenever a stack's events " "exceed max_events_per_stack. This may be " "set according to the memory consumed by the agent ramdisk image." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-agent.rst:33 msgid "``post_deploy_get_power_state_retries`` = ``6``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-agent.rst:34 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Number of times to retry getting power state to check if bare metal " "node has been powered off after a soft power off." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-agent.rst:35 msgid "``post_deploy_get_power_state_retry_interval`` = ``5``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-agent.rst:36 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Amount of time (in seconds) to wait between polling power state " "after trigger soft poweroff." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-amt.rst:19 msgid "**[amt]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-amt.rst:21 msgid "``action_wait`` = ``10``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-amt.rst:22 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Amount of time (in seconds) to wait, before retrying an AMT " "operation" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-amt.rst:23 msgid "``max_attempts`` = ``3``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-amt.rst:24 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Maximum number of times to attempt an AMT operation, before failing" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-amt.rst:25 ../tables/nova-glance.rst:37 msgid "``protocol`` = ``http``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-amt.rst:26 msgid "(StrOpt) Protocol used for AMT endpoint, support http/https" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# networking.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:21 ../tables/neutron-common.rst:23 msgid "``api_workers`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:22 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Number of workers for OpenStack Ironic API service. The default is " "equal to the number of CPUs available if that can be determined, else a " "default worker count of 1 is returned." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:23 msgid "``host_ip`` = ``0.0.0.0``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:24 msgid "(StrOpt) The IP address on which ironic-api listens." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:25 msgid "``max_limit`` = ``1000``" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# shared-file-systems.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:26 ../tables/manila-api.rst:32 msgid "" "(IntOpt) The maximum number of items returned in a single response from a " "collection resource." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:27 msgid "``port`` = ``6385``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:28 msgid "(PortOpt) The TCP port on which ironic-api listens." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-api.rst:30 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Public URL to use when building the links to the API resources (for " "example, "https://ironic.rocks:6384"). If None the links will be built " "using the request's host URL. If the API is operating behind a proxy, you " "will want to change this to represent the proxy's URL. Defaults to None." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-auth.rst:22 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Authentication strategy used by ironic-api: one of "keystone" or " ""noauth". "noauth" should not be used in a production environment " "because all authentication will be disabled." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:19 msgid "**[cimc]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:21 msgid "``action_interval`` = ``10``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:22 ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:28 #: ../tables/ironic-ilo.rst:40 msgid "(IntOpt) Amount of time in seconds to wait in between power operations" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:23 ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:29 msgid "``max_retry`` = ``6``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:24 ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:30 #: ../tables/ironic-ilo.rst:38 msgid "(IntOpt) Number of times a power operation needs to be retried" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:25 msgid "**[cisco_ucs]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-cisco_ucs.rst:27 msgid "``action_interval`` = ``5``" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:21 ../tables/nova-common.rst:21 msgid "``bindir`` = ``/usr/local/bin``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:22 msgid "(StrOpt) Directory where ironic binaries are installed." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:23 msgid "``enabled_drivers`` = ``pxe_ipmitool``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:24 msgid "" "(ListOpt) Specify the list of drivers to load during service initialization. " "Missing drivers, or drivers which fail to initialize, will prevent the " "conductor service from starting. The option default is a recommended set of " "production-oriented drivers. A complete list of drivers present on your " "system may be found by enumerating the "ironic.drivers" entrypoint. An " "example may be found in the developer documentation online." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:29 ../tables/nova-hypervisor.rst:23 msgid "``force_raw_images`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:30 msgid "(BoolOpt) If True, convert backing images to "raw" disk image format." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:31 msgid "``grub_config_template`` = ``$pybasedir/common/grub_conf.template``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:32 msgid "(StrOpt) Template file for grub configuration file." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:33 msgid "``hash_distribution_replicas`` = ``1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:34 msgid "" "(IntOpt) [Experimental Feature] Number of hosts to map onto each hash " "partition. Setting this to more than one will cause additional conductor " "services to prepare deployment environments and potentially allow the Ironic " "cluster to recover more quickly if a conductor instance is terminated." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:35 msgid "``hash_partition_exponent`` = ``5``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:36 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Exponent to determine number of hash partitions to use when " "distributing load across conductors. Larger values will result in more even " "distribution of load and less load when rebalancing the ring, but more " "memory usage. Number of partitions per conductor is " "(2^hash_partition_exponent). This determines the granularity of rebalancing: " "given 10 hosts, and an exponent of the 2, there are 40 partitions in the " "ring.A few thousand partitions should make rebalancing smooth in most cases. " "The default is suitable for up to a few hundred conductors. Too many " "partitions has a CPU impact." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:37 msgid "``hash_ring_reset_interval`` = ``180``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:38 msgid "(IntOpt) Interval (in seconds) between hash ring resets." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:40 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Name of this node. This can be an opaque identifier. It is not " "necessarily a hostname, FQDN, or IP address. However, the node name must be " "valid within an AMQP key, and if using ZeroMQ, a valid hostname, FQDN, or IP " "address." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:41 msgid "``isolinux_bin`` = ``/usr/lib/syslinux/isolinux.bin``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:42 msgid "(StrOpt) Path to isolinux binary file." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:43 msgid "" "``isolinux_config_template`` = ``$pybasedir/common/isolinux_config.template``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:44 msgid "(StrOpt) Template file for isolinux configuration file." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:48 msgid "" "(StrOpt) IP address of this host. If unset, will determine the IP " "programmatically. If unable to do so, will use "127.0.0.1"." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:49 msgid "``parallel_image_downloads`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:50 msgid "(BoolOpt) Run image downloads and raw format conversions in parallel." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:53 msgid "``pybasedir`` = ``/usr/lib/python/site-packages/ironic/ironic``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:54 msgid "(StrOpt) Directory where the ironic python module is installed." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:55 msgid "``rootwrap_config`` = ``/etc/ironic/rootwrap.conf``" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# shared-file-systems.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:56 ../tables/manila-common.rst:52 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Path to the rootwrap configuration file to use for running commands " "as root." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:57 ../tables/nova-common.rst:49 msgid "``state_path`` = ``$pybasedir``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:58 msgid "(StrOpt) Top-level directory for maintaining ironic's state." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:59 msgid "``tempdir`` = ``/tmp``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-common.rst:60 msgid "(StrOpt) Temporary working directory, default is Python temp dir." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# data-processing-service.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:19 ../tables/nova-conductor.rst:23 #: ../tables/sahara-common.rst:95 msgid "**[conductor]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:21 msgid "``api_url`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:22 msgid "" "(StrOpt) URL of Ironic API service. If not set ironic can get the current " "value from the keystone service catalog." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:23 msgid "``check_provision_state_interval`` = ``60``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:24 msgid "(IntOpt) Interval between checks of provision timeouts, in seconds." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:25 msgid "``clean_callback_timeout`` = ``1800``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:26 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Timeout (seconds) to wait for a callback from the ramdisk doing the " "cleaning. If the timeout is reached the node will be put in the "clean " "failed" provision state. Set to 0 to disable timeout." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:27 msgid "``clean_nodes`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:28 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Cleaning is a configurable set of steps, such as erasing disk " "drives, that are performed on the node to ensure it is in a baseline state " "and ready to be deployed to. This is done after instance deletion, and " "during the transition from a "managed" to "available" state. When " "enabled, the particular steps performed to clean a node depend on which " "driver that node is managed by; see the individual driver's documentation " "for details. NOTE: The introduction of the cleaning operation causes " "instance deletion to take significantly longer. In an environment where all " "tenants are trusted (eg, because there is only one tenant), this option " "could be safely disabled." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:29 msgid "``configdrive_swift_container`` = ``ironic_configdrive_container``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:30 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Name of the Swift container to store config drive data. Used when " "configdrive_use_swift is True." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:31 msgid "``configdrive_use_swift`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:32 msgid "(BoolOpt) Whether to upload the config drive to Swift." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:33 msgid "``deploy_callback_timeout`` = ``1800``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:34 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Timeout (seconds) to wait for a callback from a deploy ramdisk. Set " "to 0 to disable timeout." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:35 msgid "``force_power_state_during_sync`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:36 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) During sync_power_state, should the hardware power state be set to " "the state recorded in the database (True) or should the database be updated " "based on the hardware state (False)." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:37 msgid "``heartbeat_interval`` = ``10``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:38 msgid "(IntOpt) Seconds between conductor heart beats." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:39 msgid "``heartbeat_timeout`` = ``60``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:40 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Maximum time (in seconds) since the last check-in of a conductor. A " "conductor is considered inactive when this time has been exceeded." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:41 msgid "``inspect_timeout`` = ``1800``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:42 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Timeout (seconds) for waiting for node inspection. 0 - unlimited." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:43 msgid "``node_locked_retry_attempts`` = ``3``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:44 msgid "(IntOpt) Number of attempts to grab a node lock." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:45 msgid "``node_locked_retry_interval`` = ``1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:46 msgid "(IntOpt) Seconds to sleep between node lock attempts." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:47 msgid "``periodic_max_workers`` = ``8``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:48 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Maximum number of worker threads that can be started simultaneously " "by a periodic task. Should be less than RPC thread pool size." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:49 msgid "``power_state_sync_max_retries`` = ``3``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:50 msgid "" "(IntOpt) During sync_power_state failures, limit the number of times Ironic " "should try syncing the hardware node power state with the node power state " "in DB" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:51 msgid "``send_sensor_data`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:52 msgid "(BoolOpt) Enable sending sensor data message via the notification bus" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:53 msgid "``send_sensor_data_interval`` = ``600``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:54 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Seconds between conductor sending sensor data message to ceilometer " "via the notification bus." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:55 msgid "``send_sensor_data_types`` = ``ALL``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:56 msgid "" "(ListOpt) List of comma separated meter types which need to be sent to " "Ceilometer. The default value, "ALL", is a special value meaning send all " "the sensor data." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:57 msgid "``sync_local_state_interval`` = ``180``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:58 msgid "" "(IntOpt) When conductors join or leave the cluster, existing conductors may " "need to update any persistent local state as nodes are moved around the " "cluster. This option controls how often, in seconds, each conductor will " "check for nodes that it should "take over". Set it to a negative value to " "disable the check entirely." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:59 msgid "``sync_power_state_interval`` = ``60``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:60 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Interval between syncing the node power state to the database, in " "seconds." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:61 msgid "``workers_pool_size`` = ``100``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-conductor.rst:62 msgid "(IntOpt) The size of the workers greenthread pool." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:19 msgid "**[console]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:21 msgid "``subprocess_checking_interval`` = ``1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:22 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Time interval (in seconds) for checking the status of console " "subprocess." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:23 msgid "``subprocess_timeout`` = ``10``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:24 msgid "(IntOpt) Time (in seconds) to wait for the console subprocess to start." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:25 msgid "``terminal`` = ``shellinaboxd``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:26 msgid "(StrOpt) Path to serial console terminal program" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:27 msgid "``terminal_cert_dir`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:28 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Directory containing the terminal SSL cert(PEM) for serial console " "access" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:29 msgid "``terminal_pid_dir`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-console.rst:30 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Directory for holding terminal pid files. If not specified, the " "temporary directory will be used." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-database.rst:47 msgid "``mysql_engine`` = ``InnoDB``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-database.rst:48 msgid "(StrOpt) MySQL engine to use." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-debug.rst:22 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Enable pecan debug mode. WARNING: this is insecure and should not " "be used in a production environment." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:19 msgid "**[deploy]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:21 msgid "``dd_block_size`` = ``1M``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:22 msgid "(StrOpt) Block size to use when writing to the nodes disk." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:23 msgid "``efi_system_partition_size`` = ``200``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:24 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Size of EFI system partition in MiB when configuring UEFI systems " "for local boot." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:25 msgid "``erase_devices_iterations`` = ``1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:26 msgid "(IntOpt) Number of iterations to be run for erasing devices." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:27 msgid "``erase_devices_priority`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:28 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Priority to run in-band erase devices via the Ironic Python Agent " "ramdisk. If unset, will use the priority set in the ramdisk (defaults to 10 " "for the GenericHardwareManager). If set to 0, will not run during cleaning." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:29 msgid "``http_root`` = ``/httpboot``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:30 msgid "(StrOpt) ironic-conductor node's HTTP root path." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:31 msgid "``http_url`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:32 msgid "" "(StrOpt) ironic-conductor node's HTTP server URL. Example: " "http://192.1.2.3:8080" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:33 msgid "``iscsi_verify_attempts`` = ``3``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-deploy.rst:34 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Maximum attempts to verify an iSCSI connection is active, sleeping " "1 second between attempts." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-dhcp.rst:19 msgid "**[dhcp]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-dhcp.rst:21 msgid "``dhcp_provider`` = ``neutron``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-dhcp.rst:22 msgid "" "(StrOpt) DHCP provider to use. "neutron" uses Neutron, and "none" uses a " "no-op provider." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-disk_partitioner.rst:19 msgid "**[disk_partitioner]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-disk_partitioner.rst:21 msgid "``check_device_interval`` = ``1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-disk_partitioner.rst:22 msgid "" "(IntOpt) After Ironic has completed creating the partition table, it " "continues to check for activity on the attached iSCSI device status at this " "interval prior to copying the image to the node, in seconds" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-disk_partitioner.rst:23 msgid "``check_device_max_retries`` = ``20``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-disk_partitioner.rst:24 msgid "" "(IntOpt) The maximum number of times to check that the device is not " "accessed by another process. If the device is still busy after that, the " "disk partitioning will be treated as having failed." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-drac.rst:19 msgid "**[drac]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-drac.rst:21 msgid "``client_retry_count`` = ``5``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-drac.rst:22 msgid "" "(IntOpt) In case there is a communication failure, the DRAC client resends " "the request as many times as defined in this setting." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-drac.rst:23 msgid "``client_retry_delay`` = ``5``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-drac.rst:24 msgid "" "(IntOpt) In case there is a communication failure, the DRAC client waits for " "as many seconds as defined in this setting before resending the request." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:19 ../tables/nova-glance.rst:23 msgid "**[glance]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:22 msgid "" "(ListOpt) A list of URL schemes that can be downloaded directly via the " "direct_url. Currently supported schemes: [file]." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:24 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Authentication strategy to use when connecting to glance. Only " ""keystone" and "noauth" are currently supported by ironic." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:26 msgid "(BoolOpt) Allow to perform insecure SSL (https) requests to glance." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:27 msgid "``glance_api_servers`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:28 msgid "" "(ListOpt) A list of the glance api servers available to ironic. Prefix with " "https:// for SSL-based glance API servers. Format is [hostname|IP]:port." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:30 msgid "(StrOpt) Default glance hostname or IP address." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:32 msgid "(IntOpt) Number of retries when downloading an image from glance." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:34 msgid "(PortOpt) Default glance port." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:35 msgid "``glance_protocol`` = ``http``" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# bare-metal.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:36 ../tables/nova-glance.rst:38 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Default protocol to use when connecting to glance. Set to https for " "SSL." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:37 msgid "``swift_account`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:38 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The account that Glance uses to communicate with Swift. The format " "is "AUTH_uuid". "uuid" is the UUID for the account configured in the " "glance-api.conf. Required for temporary URLs when Glance backend is Swift. " "For example: "AUTH_a422b2-91f3-2f46-74b7-d7c9e8958f5d30". Swift temporary " "URL format: "endpoint_url/api_version/[account/]container/object_id"" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:39 msgid "``swift_api_version`` = ``v1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:40 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The Swift API version to create a temporary URL for. Defaults to " ""v1". Swift temporary URL format: "endpoint_url/api_version/" "[account/]container/object_id"" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:41 msgid "``swift_container`` = ``glance``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:42 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The Swift container Glance is configured to store its images in. " "Defaults to "glance", which is the default in glance-api.conf. Swift " "temporary URL format: "endpoint_url/api_version/[account/]container/" "object_id"" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:43 msgid "``swift_endpoint_url`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:44 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The "endpoint" (scheme, hostname, optional port) for the Swift " "URL of the form "endpoint_url/api_version/[account/]container/object_id". " "Do not include trailing "/". For example, use "https://swift.example.com" "". If using RADOS Gateway, endpoint may also contain /swift path; if it " "does not, it will be appended. Required for temporary URLs." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:46 msgid "" "(IntOpt) This should match a config by the same name in the Glance " "configuration file. When set to 0, a single-tenant store will only use one " "container to store all images. When set to an integer value between 1 and " "32, a single-tenant store will use multiple containers to store images, and " "this value will determine how many containers are created." msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:47 msgid "``swift_temp_url_duration`` = ``1200``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/ironic-glance.rst:48 msgid "" "(IntOpt) The length of time in seconds that the temporary URL will be valid " "for. Defaults to 20 minutes. By default this mapping is disabled, which " "ensures that existing IDs will not change. Even when the mapping is enabled " "by using domain specific drivers, any users and groups from the default " "domain being handled by LDAP will still not be mapped to ensure their IDs " "remain backward compatible. Setting this value to False will enable the " "mapping for even the default LDAP driver. It is only safe to do this if you " "do not already have assignments for users and groups from the default LDAP " "domain, and it is acceptable for Keystone to provide the different IDs to " "clients than it did previously. Typically this means that the only time you " "can set this value to False is when configuring a fresh installation." msgstr "" #: ../tables/keystone-mapping.rst:24 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Entrypoint for the identity mapping backend driver in the keystone." In this case, even if " "availability_zone_hints for a resource is empty, availability zone is " "considered for high availability while scheduling the resource." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:39 msgid "``default_ipv4_subnet_pool`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:40 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Default IPv4 subnet pool to be used for automatic subnet CIDR " "allocation. Specifies by UUID the pool to be used in case where creation of " "a subnet is being called without a subnet pool ID. If not set then no pool " "will be used unless passed explicitly to the subnet create. If no pool is " "used, then a CIDR must be passed to create a subnet and that subnet will not " "be allocated from any pool; it will be considered part of the tenant's " "private address space. This option is deprecated for removal in the N " "release." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:41 msgid "``default_ipv6_subnet_pool`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:42 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Default IPv6 subnet pool to be used for automatic subnet CIDR " "allocation. Specifies by UUID the pool to be used in case where creation of " "a subnet is being called without a subnet pool ID. See the description for " "default_ipv4_subnet_pool for more information. This option is deprecated for " "removal in the N release." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:43 msgid "``dhcp_agent_notification`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:44 msgid "(BoolOpt) Allow sending resource operation notification to DHCP agent" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:45 msgid "``dhcp_agents_per_network`` = ``1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:46 msgid "" "(IntOpt) Number of DHCP agents scheduled to host a tenant network. If this " "number is greater than 1, the scheduler automatically assigns multiple DHCP " "agents for a given tenant network, providing high availability for DHCP " "service." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:47 msgid "``dhcp_broadcast_reply`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:48 msgid "(BoolOpt) Use broadcast in DHCP replies" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:49 msgid "``dhcp_confs`` = ``$state_path/dhcp``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:50 msgid "(StrOpt) Location to store DHCP server config files" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:51 msgid "``dhcp_domain`` = ``openstacklocal``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:52 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Domain to use for building the hostnames.This option is deprecated. " "It has been moved to neutron.conf as dns_domain. It will removed from here " "in a future release" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:53 msgid "``dhcp_lease_duration`` = ``86400``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:54 msgid "" "(IntOpt) DHCP lease duration (in seconds). Use -1 to tell dnsmasq to use " "infinite lease times." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:55 msgid "``dhcp_load_type`` = ``networks``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:56 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Representing the resource type whose load is being reported by the " "agent. This can be "networks", "subnets" or "ports". When specified " "(Default is networks), the server will extract particular load sent as part " "of its agent configuration object from the agent report state, which is the " "number of resources being consumed, at every report_interval.dhcp_load_type " "can be used in combination with network_scheduler_driver = neutron.scheduler." "dhcp_agent_scheduler.WeightScheduler When the network_scheduler_driver is " "WeightScheduler, dhcp_load_type can be configured to represent the choice " "for the resource being balanced. Example: dhcp_load_type=networks" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:57 msgid "``dns_domain`` = ``openstacklocal``" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# networking.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:58 ../tables/nova-network.rst:36 msgid "(StrOpt) Domain to use for building the hostnames" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:59 msgid "``enable_new_agents`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:60 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Agent starts with admin_state_up=False when " "enable_new_agents=False. But manual scheduling to " "such agents is available if this option is True." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:65 msgid "``force_gateway_on_subnet`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-common.rst:66 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Ensure that configured gateway is on subnet. If " "this section is null, disable dnsmasq log." msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# networking.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:27 ../tables/nova-network.rst:47 msgid "``dnsmasq_config_file`` =" msgstr "" # #-#-#-#-# compute.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# # #-#-#-#-# networking.pot (Configuration Reference 0.9) #-#-#-#-# #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:28 ../tables/nova-network.rst:48 msgid "(StrOpt) Override the default dnsmasq settings with this file" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:29 msgid "``dnsmasq_dns_servers`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:30 msgid "" "(ListOpt) Comma-separated list of the DNS servers which will be used as " "forwarders." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:31 msgid "``dnsmasq_lease_max`` = ``16777216``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:32 msgid "(IntOpt) Limit number of leases to prevent a denial-of-service." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:33 msgid "``enable_isolated_metadata`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:34 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) The DHCP server can assist with providing metadata support on " "isolated networks. Setting this value to True will cause the DHCP server to " "append specific host routes to the DHCP request. The metadata service will " "only be activated when the subnet does not contain any router port. The " "guest instance must be configured to request host routes via DHCP (Option " "121). This option doesn't have any effect when force_metadata is set to True." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:35 msgid "``enable_metadata_network`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:36 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Allows for serving metadata requests coming from a dedicated " "metadata access network whose CIDR is 169.254.169.254/16 (or larger prefix), " "and is connected to a Neutron router from which the VMs send metadata:1 " "request. In this case DHCP Option 121 will not be injected in VMs, as they " "will be able to reach 169.254.169.254 through a router. This option requires " "enable_isolated_metadata = True." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:37 msgid "``force_metadata`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:38 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) In some cases the Neutron router is not present to provide the " "metadata IP but the DHCP server can be used to provide this info. Setting " "this value will force the DHCP server to append specific host routes to the " "DHCP request. If this option is set, then the metadata service will be " "activated for all the networks." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:39 ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:47 msgid "``host`` = ``example.domain``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dhcp_agent.rst:40 ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:48 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Hostname to be used by the Neutron server, agents and services " "running on this machine. The interval is number of seconds " "between attempts." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dvr.rst:21 msgid "``dvr_base_mac`` = ``fa:16:3f:00:00:00``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dvr.rst:22 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The base mac address used for unique DVR instances by Neutron. The 'dvr_base_mac' " "*must* be different from 'base_mac' to avoid mixing them up with MAC's " "allocated for tenant ports. A 4 octet example would be dvr_base_mac = " "fa:16:3f:4f:00:00. The default is 3 octet" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dvr.rst:23 msgid "``router_distributed`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-dvr.rst:24 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) System-wide flag to determine the type of router that tenants can " "create. "``extensions`` =" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l2_agent.rst:22 msgid "(ListOpt) Extensions list to use" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:21 msgid "``agent_mode`` = ``legacy``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:22 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The working mode for the agent. Allowed modes are: 'legacy' - this " "preserves the existing behavior where the L3 agent is deployed on a " "centralized networking node to provide L3 services like DNAT, and SNAT. Use " "this mode if you do not want to adopt DVR. 'dvr' - this mode enables DVR " "functionality and must be used for an L3 agent that runs on a compute host. " "'dvr_snat' - this enables centralized SNAT support in conjunction with DVR. " "This mode must be used for an L3 agent running on a centralized node (or in " "single-host deployments, e.g. devstack)" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:23 msgid "``allow_automatic_dhcp_failover`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:24 msgid "(BoolOpt) Automatically remove networks from offline DHCP agents." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:25 msgid "``allow_automatic_l3agent_failover`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:26 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Automatically reschedule routers from offline L3 agents to online " "L3 agents." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:27 msgid "``enable_metadata_proxy`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:28 msgid "(BoolOpt) Allow running metadata proxy." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:29 msgid "``enable_snat_by_default`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:30 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Define the default value of enable_snat if not provided in " "external_gateway_info." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:31 msgid "``external_ingress_mark`` = ``0x2``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:32 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Iptables mangle mark used to mark ingress from external network. " "This mark will be masked with 0xffff so that only the lower 16 bits will be " "used." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:33 msgid "``external_network_bridge`` = ``br-ex``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:34 msgid "" "(StrOpt) Name of bridge used for external network traffic. This should be " "set to an empty value for the Linux Bridge. When this parameter is set, each " "L3 agent can be associated with no more than one external network. This " "option is deprecated and will be removed in the M release." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:35 msgid "``gateway_external_network_id`` =" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:36 msgid "" "(StrOpt) When external_network_bridge is set, each L3 agent can be " "associated with no more than one external network. This value should be set " "to the UUID of that external network. To allow L3 agent support multiple " "external networks, both the external_network_bridge and " "gateway_external_network_id must be left empty." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:37 msgid "``ha_confs_path`` = ``$state_path/ha_confs``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:38 msgid "(StrOpt) Location to store keepalived/conntrackd config files" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:39 msgid "``ha_vrrp_advert_int`` = ``2``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:40 msgid "(IntOpt) The advertisement interval in seconds" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:41 msgid "``ha_vrrp_auth_password`` = ``None``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:42 msgid "(StrOpt) VRRP authentication password" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:43 msgid "``ha_vrrp_auth_type`` = ``PASS``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:44 msgid "(StrOpt) VRRP authentication type" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:45 msgid "``handle_internal_only_routers`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:46 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Indicates that this L3 agent should also handle routers that do " "not have an external network gateway configured. This option should be True " "only for a single agent in a Neutron deployment, and may be False for all " "agents if all routers must have an external network gateway." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:51 msgid "``ipv6_gateway`` =" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:52 msgid "" "(StrOpt) With IPv6, the network used for the external gateway does not need " "to have an associated subnet, since the automatically assigned link-local " "address (LLA) can be used. However, an IPv6 gateway address is needed for " "use as the next-hop for the default route. If no IPv6 gateway address is " "configured here, (and only then) the neutron router will be configured to " "get its default route from router advertisements (RAs) from the upstream " "router; in which case the upstream router must also be configured to send " "these RAs. The ipv6_gateway, when configured, should be the LLA of the " "interface on the upstream router. If a next-hop using a global unique " "address (GUA) is desired, it needs to be done via a subnet allocated to the " "network and not through this parameter." msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:53 msgid "``ipv6_pd_enabled`` = ``False``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/neutron-l3_agent.rst:54 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Enables IPv6 Prefix Delegation for automatic subnet CIDR " "allocation. Set to True to enable IPv6 Prefix Delegation for subnet " "allocation in a PD-capable environment. Users making subnet creation " "requests for IPv6 subnets without providing a CIDR or subnetpool ID will be " "given a CIDR via the Prefix Delegation mechanism. These are lifecycle events raised from compute drivers " "that implement the method. An example of a lifecycle event is an instance " "starting or stopping. If the instance is going through task state changes " "due to an API operation, like resize, the events are ignored. However, this " "is an advanced feature which allows the hypervisor to signal to the compute " "service that an unexpected state change has occurred in an instance and the " "instance can be shutdown automatically - which can inherently race in reboot " "operations or when the compute service or host is rebooted, either planned " "or due to an unexpected outage. Care should be taken when using this and " "sync_power_state_interval is negative since then if any instances are out of " "sync between the hypervisor and the Nova database they will have to be " "synchronized manually. "cells.weights.all_weighers" maps to all cell weighers included with nova." msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:91 msgid "**[metrics]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:93 msgid "``required`` = ``True``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:94 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) How to treat the unavailable metrics. When a metric is NOT " "available for a host, if it is set to be True, it would raise an exception, " "so it is recommended to use the scheduler filter MetricFilter to filter out " "those hosts. If it is set to be False, the unavailable metric would be " "treated as a negative factor in weighing process, the returned value would " "be set by the option weight_of_unavailable." msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:95 msgid "``weight_multiplier`` = ``1.0``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:96 msgid "(FloatOpt) Multiplier used for weighing metrics." msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:97 msgid "``weight_of_unavailable`` = ``-10000.0``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:98 msgid "" "(FloatOpt) The final weight value to be returned if required is set to False " "and any one of the metrics set by weight_setting is unavailable." msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:99 msgid "``weight_setting`` =" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-scheduler.rst:100 msgid "" "(ListOpt) How the metrics are going to be weighed. This should be in the " "form of "<name1>=<ratio1>, <name2>=<ratio2>, ...", where <nameX> is one of " "the metrics to be weighed, and <ratioX> is the corresponding ratio. So for " ""name1=1.0, name2=-1.0" The final weight would be name1.value * 1.0 + " "name2.value * -1.0." msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-serial_console.rst:19 msgid "**[serial_console]**" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-serial_console.rst:21 msgid "``base_url`` = ``ws://127.0.0.1:6083/``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-serial_console.rst:22 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The URL an end user would use to connect to the ``nova-" "serialproxy`` service. " "Possible values: * <scheme><IP-address><port-number> Services which consume " "this: * ``nova-compute`` Interdependencies to other options: * The IP " "address must be identical to the address to which the ``nova-serialproxy`` " "service is listening (see option ``serialproxy_host`` in this section). * " "The port must be the same as in the option ``serialproxy_port`` of this " "section. * If you choose to use a secured websocket connection, then start " "this option with ``wss://`` instead of the unsecured ``ws://``. The options " "``cert`` and ``key`` in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section have to be set for that." msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-serial_console.rst:24 msgid "" "(BoolOpt) Enable the serial console feature. Possible values: Each string which passes the regex ``\d+:\d" "+`` For example ``10000:20000``. Be sure that the first port number is lower " "than the second port number. Services which consume this: * ``nova-compute`` " "Interdependencies to other options: * None" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-serial_console.rst:29 msgid "``proxyclient_address`` = ``127.0.0.1``" msgstr "" #: ../tables/nova-serial_console.rst:30 msgid "" "(StrOpt) The IP address to which proxy clients (like ``nova-serialproxy``) " "should connect to get the serial console of an instance. For an HA master-" "slave Redis cluster using Redis Sentinel, use the form "redis://host1[:" "port1][,host2[:port2],...,hostN[:portN]][?options]", where each host " "specified corresponds to an instance of redis-sentinel. In this form, the " "name of the Redis master used in the Sentinel configuration must be included " "in the query string as "master=<name>". Finally, to connect to a local " "instance of Redis over a unix socket, you may use the form "redis:/path/to/" "redis.sock[?options]". In all forms, the "socket_timeout" option may be " "specified in the query string. Its value is given in seconds. subject: Add an environment to use a swap partition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-06 21:06:25.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/all_nodes/swap-partition.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/94f580370d1104fb0f0d076cd3c3fd572cd961e8', 'message': "Add an environment to use a swap partition

a device with the given label as specified by the swap_partition_label
parameter.

If Ironic is used to create the swap partition, the partition will have
a label of swap1, so that's a reasonable default for the parameter.

"}]
commit_message:
Add an environment to use a swap partition

This environment can be used with AllNodesExtraConfig to enable swap on
a device with the given label as specified by the swap_partition_label
parameter.

If Ironic is used to create the swap partition, the partition will have
a label of swap1, so that's a reasonable default for the parameter.

The partition is also written to /etc/fstab as a swap mount so that it
will be enabled on reboot.

Change-Id: I5cd68c13dbfe53eecf6c6ad93151eadc980a902d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/84/289084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Partition is not the key
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 06:24:37.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_common/kafka/producer.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-common/commit/d2c347e2bddc056474500218d0518b16a1b27a41', 'message': "Partition is not the key

When publising batch messages to kafka
key was assumed to be the same thing as
partition. That lead to errors like

 TopicAndPartition(
   topic='log',
   partition='43243242352352') not available

where partition was current timestamp for instance.
Commit provides selecting the best partition for
given key and using it to publish messages

Change-Id: Id81520af5b3c243f7f9947e00df5fb07f06021fc
"}]
commit_message:
Partition is not the key

When publising batch messages to kafka
key was assumed to be the same thing as
partition. That lead to errors like

 TopicAndPartition(
   topic='log',
   partition='43243242352352') not available

where partition was current timestamp for instance.
Commit provides selecting the best partition for
given key and using it to publish messages

Change-Id: Id81520af5b3c243f7f9947e00df5fb07f06021fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-common refs/changes/33/289733/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: partition = self._producer._next_partition(topic, str(key)) self._producer.send_messages(topic, partition, *messages)

commit_message:
Add missing setting for cache

The install guide instructs how to use memcached for a session
store for Horizon. It configures the caches, but does not actually
tell Horizon to use it for sessions. The default is signed-cookies
for sessions not caching.

This patch adds the setting to tell Horizon to use the cache for
sessions.

Change-Id: I7cd2add9df5dd699879dbdd1406495dc03f5267b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/37/289637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SESSION_ENGINE = 'django.contrib.sessions.backends.cache' SESSION_ENGINE = 'django.contrib.sessions.backends.cache' SESSION_ENGINE = 'django.contrib.sessions.backends.cache'

commit_message:
Add a neutron-full variant with fwaas tests from tempest plugins

As experiment for now.
This enables a tempest plugin provided by neutron-fwaas.
Intended to replace neutron-full jobs in a long run.

The REGEX is intentionally restricted to tempest and fwaas
to avoid tempest plugins from random repositories slipping in.

Change-Id: I962a9b60f27b19f5a656c4c259b4d2de45f035d6

commit_message:
Nit: occurrences of barbican in small letter.

Changed occurence of Barbican to barbican beacuse according to
convention, project name should start with small letter.

Reference:
https://governance.openstack.org/reference/service-project-naming.html

Closes-Bug: #1553349

commit_message:
Fix potential race condition in lbaas v2 logic

In the event that multiple resources under the same loadbalancer get
the affirmative that the loadbalancer is no longer updating before
either of those resources actually perform their action, neutron will
throw a PENDING_UPDATE error when the second resource attempts to
perform its action.

This patch implements the "better to ask forgiveness than to ask for
permmission" adage. Instead of checking whether the loadbalancer is
ready for an action to be performed, we should just try the action.
If it fails, we catch the error and try again later.

Closes-Bug: #1552724

Change-Id: I9f6e164ed838aa298a41b4ed2a6061a927787a4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/84/287484/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
