commit_message:
Support network isolation without external nets

This patch adds extra heat environments that can be used
to enable network isolation without using the external
network. Instead of a separate external network the ctlplane
will be used for all of the external/public traffic.

Change-Id: Ia542cee02121771d7d57ac701b62d7608e8d1855
(cherry picked from commit 58349641541cc0e3b502311344d290c2afde7da5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/99/287599/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: There are two versions of the controller role template, one with an external network interface, and another without. If the external network interface is not configured the ctlplane address ranges will be used for external (public) network traffic. Configuration with no External Network -------------------------------------- Same as above except set the following value for the controller role: OS::TripleO::Controller::Net::SoftwareConfig: network/config/single-nic-vlans/controller-no-external.yaml

commit_message:
Create test mapping for puppet-modules

As part of fuel-library-gates, adding mapping structure for puppet modules.
For each system-test as a key exist list of deployment/puppet,
deployment/Puppetfile, osnailyfactor/modular modules which it's system-test covers.
Mapping takes list of modules edit in review and register single test group - "review_fuel_library"
which mapped to system_test from mapping.

Change-Id: Ibce134668d74914bc6e3c5bdabadf6b5312dd3de
Closes-bug: #1529787

subject: Make the content of PKG-INFO can be decoded
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 09:13:58.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/0e85d8ca2db09c1d8659af715b800f1a3634bfb5', 'message': 'Make the content of PKG-INFO can be decoded

The README.rst contain a dash which is \xe2\x80\x93, the PKG-INFO file
will generated by the content of README.rst when install gnocchi package.
And the pbr will read the PKG-INFO file to get package info, in py34
environment, the dash cannot be decoded and will raise an error.

Change-Id: I6a3c85beb260115e7ad32bfe101ced25442aa8d1
Closes-Bug: #1553893
(cherry picked from commit cd7813c9bd800918dd18516e733698cd7f15f493)
'}]
commit_message:
Make the content of PKG-INFO can be decoded

The README.rst contain a dash which is \xe2\x80\x93, the PKG-INFO file
will generated by the content of README.rst when install gnocchi package.
And the pbr will read the PKG-INFO file to get package info, in py34
environment, the dash cannot be decoded and will raise an error.

Change-Id: I6a3c85beb260115e7ad32bfe101ced25442aa8d1
Closes-Bug: #1553893
(cherry picked from commit cd7813c9bd800918dd18516e733698cd7f15f493)

commit_message:
synchronously delete archives

it's safe to delete upgraded metrics asynchronously because they are
removed from indexer and not accessible afterwards. this is not the
case for archives as they may relate to active metrics. we should
delete them completely so we don't access them again.

Change-Id: I3b8baaf1609a003c7d09b59a84570c66035a8183

Adds default value for volume_backed argument.

merge pbr deliverable files into independent directory

pbr uses the independent release model, so should not have deliverables
listed in each series.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

the other info about the commit being tagged.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove unsafe "unset" defaults

All of our sensitive parameters are defaulted to easily predictable
values, which is very bad from a security perspective because we don't
force clients to make sane choices thus risk deploying with the
predictable default values.  tripleoclient supports generating random
values for all of these, so remove the defaults, for non-tripleoclient
usage we can create a developer-only environment with defaults.

Related-Bug: #1516027
Change-Id: Ia0cf3b7e2de1aa42cf179cba195fb7770a1fc21c
Depends-On: Ifb34b43fdedc55ad220df358c3ccc31e3c2e7c14
(cherry picked from commit 293f19b2a41386e1eea47a9e6add24b006c69c42)

commit_message:
Location add catch bad Uri

If a location is added with the Uri 'file://' or something similar it
would cause the sever to raise a internal error. This now catches that
exception, so the server can raise a 400 error.

This has now been merged on liberty.

Closes-Bug: 1502850
Change-Id: I10e4a65dea4a951e00c8ed92d0c3cdd74a786ace
(cherry picked from commit ad8af56036c7a253813585003b3ff9ea3745fc4d)

commit_message:
Changed the ordering for sudoers where used

The sudoers file was being created in the pre-install tasks
which causes an incorrect configuration variable to be dropped
when the venv env is not turned on. To correct this issue the
sudoers template is now dropped in the post install task file
after the bin_path fact has been set.

This change also removes the directory create task for heat, keystone,
glance, and swift because no sudoers files are needed for these services.

Re-Implementation-Of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277674/1
Change-Id: I609c9c12579dc1897787d19a1f58fe3e919b5e35
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Changed the ordering for sudoers where used

The sudoers file was being created in the pre-install tasks
which causes an incorrect configuration variable to be dropped
when the venv env is not turned on. To correct this issue the
sudoers template is now dropped in the post install task file
after the bin_path fact has been set.

This change also removes the directory create task for heat, keystone,
glance, and swift because no sudoers files are needed for these services.

Re-Implementation-Of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277674/1
Change-Id: I609c9c12579dc1897787d19a1f58fe3e919b5e35
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 16:19:44.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upgrade-non-controller.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/463cf7f922291dc47593caabe5ef4e8b728c2f55', 'message': 'Adds override for the overcloud node user in upgrade-non-controller

The upgrade-non-controller.sh script currently assumed there is a
heat-admin user on the overcloud nodes. This may not be the case in
some environments. Allow override by export UPGRADE_NODE_USER=foo
before running the upgrade-non-controller.sh script. The user
must have passwordless sudo priviliges otherwise the upgrade script
will fail.

Change-Id: I33026dff7f89032c43f31eaf03fd15fcb09d0050
'}]
commit_message:
Adds override for the overcloud node user in upgrade-non-controller

The upgrade-non-controller.sh script currently assumed there is a
heat-admin user on the overcloud nodes. This may not be the case in
some environments. Allow override by export UPGRADE_NODE_USER=foo
before running the upgrade-non-controller.sh script. The user
must have passwordless sudo priviliges otherwise the upgrade script
will fail.

Change-Id: I33026dff7f89032c43f31eaf03fd15fcb09d0050
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/53/287953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #allow override incase the ssh user is not 'heat-admin' - must be able to sudo UPGRADE_NODE_USER=${UPGRADE_NODE_USER:-"heat-admin"} results=$(ssh $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip "sudo ls -l $UPGRADE_SCRIPT") log "Sending upgrade script $script to $node_ip as $UPGRADE_NODE_USER" scp $script $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip:/home/$UPGRADE_NODE_USER/$file_name ssh $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip "sudo cp /home/$UPGRADE_NODE_USER/$file_name $UPGRADE_SCRIPT ; \ ssh $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip sudo $UPGRADE_SCRIPT ssh $UPGRADE_NODE_USER@$node_ip "sudo journalctl -n 1000 | grep tripleo-upgrade"
deleted_lines: results=$(ssh heat-admin@$node_ip "sudo ls -l $UPGRADE_SCRIPT") log "Sending upgrade script $script to $node_ip" scp $script heat-admin@$node_ip:/home/heat-admin/$file_name ssh heat-admin@$node_ip "sudo cp /home/heat-admin/$file_name $UPGRADE_SCRIPT ; \ ssh heat-admin@$node_ip sudo $UPGRADE_SCRIPT ssh heat-admin@$node_ip "sudo journalctl -n 1000 | grep tripleo-upgrade"

commit_message:
Use non-constraint jobs for neutron/master

Neutron is the only repo using -constraints tox targets, let's switch
them back to the normal jobs since those are constraint enabled now.

Obsolete templates for -constraints targets will be cleaned up from zuul
once neutron/liberty branch switches back to regular tox target names.

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iea3a0b1f740d5679ebfa135f2bf5b89c52008716
Depends-On: Ica2d509df0c54496aba7cb3162565384cc5d34c8

controller template. For ipv6 we need to delimit the address with

commit_message:
Fixup swift device string to delimit the ipv6 address with []

The swift device string is formatted in the outputs of the
controller template and swift-storage templates.
For ipv6 we need to delimit the address with [] as discussed in
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1296701#c0

Change-Id: Ie611d62c3668a65a7be52777a613d265682c6a8b
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1534135

subject: optimise timeseries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 08:31:12.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/carbonara.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/43f0775e4caf54c40564c08c7913f9d31f058434', 'message': "optimise timeseries

we don't need necessarily need to use to sort_index when using
set_values because the ts is sorted and the ts passed in may be
sorted (via BoundedTimeSerie). we should sort only when required.

also, it's much more efficient to remove duplicates by leveraging
duplicated() vs groupby(level=0).last()[1]

this patch also uses drop rather than overly complicated double slice
and merging that was happening previously.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/489078/

Change-Id: Iec84957eceee57a430655379ef4a94a20cd6a6ff
Related-Bug: #1548448
"}]
commit_message:
optimise timeseries

we don't need necessarily need to use to sort_index when using
set_values because the ts is sorted and the ts passed in may be
sorted (via BoundedTimeSerie). we should sort only when required.

also, it's much more efficient to remove duplicates by leveraging
duplicated() vs groupby(level=0).last()[1]

this patch also uses drop rather than overly complicated double slice
and merging that was happening previously.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/489078/

Change-Id: Iec84957eceee57a430655379ef4a94a20cd6a6ff
Related-Bug: #1548448
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/18/289218/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.ts = ts[~ts.index.duplicated(keep='last')] if not self.ts.index.is_monotonic: self.ts = self.ts.sort_index() t = pandas.Series(*reversed(list(zip(*values)))) t = t[~t.index.duplicated(keep='last')] if not t.index.is_monotonic: t = t.sort_index() self.ts = t.combine_first(self.ts) new_ts = self.ts.drop(self.ts[first_timestamp:last_timestamp].index)
deleted_lines: self.ts = ts.groupby(level=0).last().sort_index() t = pandas.Series(*reversed(list(zip(*values)))).groupby( level=0).last() self.ts = t.combine_first(self.ts).sort_index() new_ts = self.ts[:first_timestamp].combine_first( self.ts[last_timestamp:])

commit_message:
close queues

metricd service catches SIGTERM and kills all children
multiprocessing handles. we can't detect queues at this step so
inspect the children and kill queues as required.

Change-Id: I226a0ba317ec4412159c2afa8f68895e00535e51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/17/289217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _metricd_cleanup(workers) _metricd_cleanup(workers)def _metricd_cleanup(workers): for worker in workers: if hasattr(worker, 'queue'): worker.queue.close()
deleted_lines: _metricd_cleanup(workers, queues) _metricd_cleanup(workers, queues)def _metricd_cleanup(workers, queues): for queue in queues: queue.close() for worker in workers:

commit_message:
Set python-fuelclient to release:independent

python-fuelclient is currently tagged with a
release:cycle-with-intermediary model, but everything
else in Fuel is using a release:independent model and
python-fuelclient doesn't seem to follow cycles anyway.

This will need Fuel PTL's +1.

Change-Id: Ia6a6f6d122b4d0cc57d24b47bea7ad7ff5a2af38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/55/277955/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Call verify_bootstrap_on_node with ip instead of remote object

In order to use new context manager we need to call
verify_bootstrap_on_node with ip address instead of
remote object. Now deploy_with_two_ubuntu_bootstraps
system test failed because remote object used

Change-Id: I1495bbf935b68da5a2497fb8f7871b57cab6ef46
Closes-Bug: #1552817

subject: Make the content of PKG-INFO can be decoded
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 06:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/cd7813c9bd800918dd18516e733698cd7f15f493', 'message': 'Make the content of PKG-INFO can be decoded

The README.rst contain a dash which is \xe2\x80\x93, the PKG-INFO file
will generated by the content of README.rst when install gnocchi package.
And the pbr will read the PKG-INFO file to get package info, in py34
environment, the dash cannot be decoded and will raise an error.

Change-Id: I6a3c85beb260115e7ad32bfe101ced25442aa8d1
Closes-Bug: #1553893
'}]
commit_message:
Make the content of PKG-INFO can be decoded

The README.rst contain a dash which is \xe2\x80\x93, the PKG-INFO file
will generated by the content of README.rst when install gnocchi package.
And the pbr will read the PKG-INFO file to get package info, in py34
environment, the dash cannot be decoded and will raise an error.

Change-Id: I6a3c85beb260115e7ad32bfe101ced25442aa8d1
Closes-Bug: #1553893

commit_message:
Use user-defined exception in execute_on_remote

We need user-defined exception in execute_on_remote to
catch it in failover tests. Base Exception isn't suitable
as it mask all other exception types

Change-Id: Ic48d73c2fabcf32eed8b57db047d60307e8ce63a
Closes-Bug: #1552692
